item.title: Keynote Speaker
item.dc:creator: kirstenkeister
item.content:encoded:
[fusion_builder_container hundred_percent="no" equal_height_columns="no" menu_anchor="" hide_on_mobile="small-visibility,medium-visibility,large-visibility" class="" id="" background_color="" background_image="" background_position="center center" background_repeat="no-repeat" fade="no" background_parallax="none" enable_mobile="no" parallax_speed="0.3" video_mp4="" video_webm="" video_ogv="" video_url="" video_aspect_ratio="16:9" video_loop="yes" video_mute="yes" video_preview_image="" border_size="" border_color="" border_style="solid" margin_top="" margin_bottom="" padding_top="" padding_right="" padding_bottom="" padding_left=""][fusion_builder_row][fusion_builder_column type="1_1" layout="1_1" spacing="" center_content="no" hover_type="none" link="" min_height="" hide_on_mobile="small-visibility,medium-visibility,large-visibility" class="" id="" background_color="" background_image="" background_position="left top" background_repeat="no-repeat" border_size="0" border_color="" border_style="solid" border_position="all" padding_top="" padding_right="" padding_bottom="" padding_left="" dimension_margin="" animation_type="" animation_direction="left" animation_speed="0.3" animation_offset="" last="no"][fusion_imageframe image_id="1386" style_type="none" stylecolor="" hover_type="none" bordersize="3" bordercolor="" borderradius="" align="left" lightbox="no" gallery_id="" lightbox_image="" alt="Seb Chan" link="" linktarget="_self" hide_on_mobile="small-visibility,medium-visibility,large-visibility" class="" id="" animation_type="" animation_direction="left" animation_speed="0.3" animation_offset=""]http://dhtraining.org/hilt/wp-content/uploads/keynote_seb-chan-200x300.jpg[/fusion_imageframe][fusion_text]

Seb Chan is currently the Director of Digital & Emerging Media at the Smithsonian, Cooper-Hewitt, National Design Museum in New York City. He is responsible for museum’s complete digital renewal during a time when the museum is rebuilding and transforming into a ’21st century museum’.

Until November 2011, he led the Digital, Social and Emerging Technologies department at the Powerhouse Museum in Sydney, Australia where he oversaw the implementation of Open Access and Creative Commons licensing policies and many projects exploring new ways for visitors and citizens to engage and contribute to the Powerhouse’s collection. Chan was a member of the Australian Government’s Government 2.0 Taskforce and he has helped organizations and institutions all over the world strategize and implement cutting-edge technologies in the cultural sector.

Please visit Seb's personal site for more information.

[/fusion_text][/fusion_builder_column][fusion_builder_column type="1_1" layout="1_1" spacing="" center_content="no" hover_type="none" link="" min_height="" item.content:encoded:
[fusion_builder_container admin_label="" hundred_percent="no" equal_height_columns="no" menu_anchor="" hide_on_mobile="small-visibility,medium-visibility,large-visibility" class="" id="" background_color="" background_image="" background_position="center center" background_repeat="no-repeat" fade="no" background_parallax="none" enable_mobile="no" parallax_speed="0.3" video_mp4="" video_webm="" video_ogv="" video_url="" video_aspect_ratio="16:9" video_loop="yes" video_mute="yes" video_preview_image="" border_size="" border_color="" border_style="solid" margin_top="0" margin_bottom="0" padding_top="" padding_right="" padding_bottom="" padding_left=""][fusion_builder_row][fusion_builder_column type="1_1" layout="1_1" spacing="" center_content="no" hover_type="none" link="" min_height="" hide_on_mobile="small-visibility,medium-visibility,large-visibility" class="" id="" background_color="" background_image="" background_position="left top" undefined="" background_repeat="no-repeat" border_size="0" border_color="" border_style="solid" border_position="all" padding_top="0" padding_right="0px" padding_bottom="0" padding_left="0px" margin_top="0" margin_bottom="0" animation_type="" animation_direction="left" animation_speed="0.3" animation_offset="" last="no"][fusion_title margin_top="0" margin_bottom="20px" hide_on_mobile="small-visibility,medium-visibility,large-visibility" class="" id="" size="2" content_align="left" style_type="none" sep_color=""] DATES [/fusion_title][fusion_text]
  • Early Registration: until September 1, 2012
  • Regular Registration: September 1, 2012 – December 1, 2012
[/fusion_text][fusion_title margin_top="30px" margin_bottom="20px" hide_on_mobile="small-visibility,medium-visibility,large-visibility" class="" id="" size="2" content_align="left" style_type="none" sep_color=""] COSTS [/fusion_title][fusion_title margin_top="" margin_bottom="20px" hide_on_mobile="small-visibility,medium-visibility,large-visibility" class="" id="" size="3" content_align="left" style_type="default" sep_color=""] Registration [/fusion_title][fusion_text]
  • Standard: $1250
  • Student: $600
  • Sponsored Student Scholar: $250
The default registration type is "regular". Students should enter the discount code "STUDENT" (case-sensitive) to receive the student discount. Sponsored student scholars will receive a special discount code for use in their confirmed/approved scholarship notification email. This special code should also be used in the discount code field PRIOR to beginning your registration. [/fusion_text][fusion_text] There are no registration substitutions allowed. Refunds are permitted until December 1, 2012. Refunds will be the amount of your registration type less an administrative fee of $150. For questions regarding registration, registration types, or scholarships, please email dhinstitute@umd.edu. DHWI will proceed regardless of weather, except in the case of the campus being closed for business. In the case of campus closure, pro-rated refunds will be given for the days that the campus is officially closed. Refunds will not be issued due to travel delays or closures. All weather closing related communications will be sent to your official email, posted to our website, and tweeted from the official DHWI twitter account. [/fusion_text][fusion_title margin_top="40px" margin_bottom="20px" hide_on_mobile="small-visibility,medium-visibility,large-visibility" class="" id="" size="3" content_align="left" style_type="default" sep_color=""] Scholarships [/fusion_title][fusion_text] There are a limited number of sponsored student scholarships for full-time enrolled students available for DHWI 2013 through the generosity of this year's DHWI Instructors and the Maryland Institute for Technology in the Humanities. You MUST apply for (and be notified that you have received) a scholarship prior to beginning registration. You will be provided with a registration code to complete registration to receive the scholarship discount of $250 in addition to the student rate discount (-$450). Your total course cost will then be $250. Applications are considered on a first-come, first-served rolling basis until all scholarship funds have been exhausted. Applications will be judged on need, merit, and course availability at the time of evaluation. We regret that we are unable to offer tuition reimbursements to participants who register before receiving the results of their scholarship application. Please apply using the Sponsored Student Scholarship form PRIOR to completing your registration. [/fusion_text][fusion_title margin_top="40px" margin_bottom="20px" hide_on_mobile="small-visibility,medium-visibility,large-visibility" class="" id="" size="3" content_align="left" style_type="default" sep_color=""]Accommodations[/fusion_title][fusion_text] DHWI has reserved a block of rooms at the Marriott Inn and Conference Center located on the University of Maryland campus, a ten minute walk to central campus where courses will be held. A LEED-certified green hotel, the Marriott Inn provides 300-thread-count linens, flat screen televisions, and complementary wireless internet access. Hotel rooms have been reserved are available at our discounted group rate of $189.00 per night from January 06, 2013 to January 12, 2013. Please follow this link to reserve your room: DHWI@The Marriott Inn and Conference Center Be sure to enter the correct arrival date in order to receive the special group rate. If you are experiencing difficulties or would like to inquire about making reservations outside of these dates, please contact our hotel liason Ms. Kimberle Beck 301-985-7311 or kbeck@umuc.edu and she will be able to assist you. Reservations must be made by December 17, 2012 in order to receive the group rate. If you will be sharing a room with another attendee, please indicate that there will be two people in your room, as well as make that request in the comment field of the reservations process. As the University of Maryland is located near downtown DC, we encourage participants to consider other housing opportunities to take advantage of the cultural heritage institutions in the area. Visit washington.org for information on housing, transportation, and other DC-related activities. item.title: Dates + Costs
item.dc:creator: kirstenkeister
item.content:encoded:
[fusion_builder_container hundred_percent="no" equal_height_columns="no" menu_anchor="" hide_on_mobile="small-visibility,medium-visibility,large-visibility" class="" id="" background_color="" background_image="" background_position="center center" background_repeat="no-repeat" fade="no" background_parallax="none" enable_mobile="no" parallax_speed="0.3" video_mp4="" video_webm="" video_ogv="" video_url="" video_aspect_ratio="16:9" video_loop="yes" video_mute="yes" video_preview_image="" border_size="" border_color="" border_style="solid" margin_top="" margin_bottom="" padding_top="" padding_right="" padding_bottom="" padding_left=""][fusion_builder_row][fusion_builder_column type="1_1" layout="1_2" spacing="" center_content="no" hover_type="none" link="" min_height="" hide_on_mobile="small-visibility,medium-visibility,large-visibility" class="" id="" background_color="" background_image="" background_position="left top" background_repeat="no-repeat" border_size="0" border_color="" border_style="solid" border_position="all" padding="" animation_type="" animation_direction="left" animation_speed="0.3" animation_offset="" last="no"][fusion_title margin_top="0" margin_bottom="20px" hide_on_mobile="small-visibility,medium-visibility,large-visibility" class="" id="" size="2" content_align="left" style_type="none" sep_color=""] DATES [/fusion_title][fusion_text]
  • Registration: December 2014 – July 1, 2015
  • Late Registration: July 1, 2015 – July 27, 2015 (dorms are unavailable during late registration)
[/fusion_text][fusion_title margin_top="30px" margin_bottom="20px" hide_on_mobile="small-visibility,medium-visibility,large-visibility" class="" id="" size="2" content_align="left" style_type="none" sep_color=""] COSTS [/fusion_title][fusion_title margin_top="" margin_bottom="20px" hide_on_mobile="small-visibility,medium-visibility,large-visibility" class="" id="" size="3" content_align="left" style_type="default" sep_color=""] Registration [/fusion_title][fusion_text]
  • Standard: $975
  • Early Career Scholars and Cultural Heritage Professionals: $775
  • Student: $525
Registration fees includes admittance to one course, the HILT Ignite and Social, and a HILT swag bag as well as breakfast and lunch in our campus dining hall. [/fusion_text][fusion_title margin_top="" margin_bottom="20px" hide_on_mobile="small-visibility,medium-visibility,large-visibility" class="" id="" size="3" content_align="left" style_type="default" sep_color=""] Scholarships [/fusion_title][fusion_text] This year, we are offering a number of discounts for friends of HILT: Group Discounts: Any group of 5 who register together are eligible for a 25% discount. Sponsored Student Scholarships are available to full-time enrolled students, early career scholars (terminal degree within 5 years), and current employees of galleries, archives, and museums. You MUST apply for (and be notified that you have received) a scholarship prior to beginning registration. You will be provided with a registration code to complete registration to receive the scholarship discount of $250.  You will be provided with a registration code to complete registration to receive the scholarship discount of $250. Adjusted fees will be $275 (students) and $525 (early career scholars or cultural heritage professionals). There are a limited number of sponsored student scholarships. They will be awarded on a rolling-basis until exhausted. [/fusion_text][fusion_title margin_top="40px" margin_bottom="20px" hide_on_mobile="small-visibility,medium-visibility,large-visibility" class="" id="" size="3" content_align="left" style_type="default" sep_color=""] Housing [/fusion_title][fusion_text] IUPUI Campus Housing will be offered for an additional fee in our Tower Hall: Double Occupancy Room (price per person): $345 total Single Occupancy Room (price per person): $575 total ADA-compliant single occupancy room (price per person): $575 total Housing fees include access to your assigned room from Sunday, July 26th (3 pm) to Saturday, August 1st (10 am), linens, access to the Tower fitness room, as well as breakfast and lunch in our campus dining facilities. All dormitory rooms are non-smoking. For more information on housing including check-in procedures, please go here. [/fusion_text][fusion_title margin_top="40px" margin_bottom="20px" hide_on_mobile="small-visibility,medium-visibility,large-visibility" class="" id="" size="3" content_align="left" style_type="default" sep_color=""] Parking [/fusion_title][fusion_text]Discounted parking passes are available for the week of the event at a cost of $45 per pass.[/fusion_text][/fusion_builder_column][fusion_builder_column type="1_1" layout="1_1" spacing="" center_content="no" hover_type="none" link="" min_height="" hide_on_mobile="small-visibility,medium-visibility,large-visibility" class="" id="" background_color="" background_image="" background_position="left top" undefined="" background_repeat="no-repeat" border_size="0" border_color="" border_style="solid" border_position="all" padding="0 0px 0 0px" margin_top="0" margin_bottom="0" animation_type="" animation_direction="left" animation_speed="0.3" animation_offset="" last="no"][fusion_separator style_type="single solid" hide_on_mobile="small-visibility,medium-visibility,large-visibility" class="" id="" sep_color="#665c5c" top_margin="75px" bottom_margin="40px" border_size="3" icon="" icon_circle="" icon_circle_color="" width="" alignment="center" /][/fusion_builder_column][/fusion_builder_row][/fusion_builder_container][fusion_builder_container admin_label="Logos" hundred_percent="no" equal_height_columns="yes" menu_anchor="" item.title: Logistics
item.dc:creator: kirstenkeister
item.content:encoded:
[fusion_builder_container hundred_percent="no" equal_height_columns="no" menu_anchor="" hide_on_mobile="small-visibility,medium-visibility,large-visibility" class="" id="" background_color="" background_image="" background_position="center center" background_repeat="no-repeat" fade="no" background_parallax="none" enable_mobile="no" parallax_speed="0.3" video_mp4="" video_webm="" video_ogv="" video_url="" video_aspect_ratio="16:9" video_loop="yes" video_mute="yes" video_preview_image="" border_size="" border_color="" border_style="solid" margin_top="" margin_bottom="" padding_top="" padding_right="" padding_bottom="" padding_left=""][fusion_builder_row][fusion_builder_column type="1_1" layout="1_1" spacing="" center_content="no" hover_type="none" link="" min_height="" hide_on_mobile="small-visibility,medium-visibility,large-visibility" class="" id="" background_color="" background_image="" background_position="left top" undefined="" background_repeat="no-repeat" border_size="0" border_color="" border_style="solid" border_position="all" padding="" margin_top="0" margin_bottom="0" animation_type="" animation_direction="left" animation_speed="0.3" animation_offset="" last="no"][fusion_text] HILT2015 will take place on the campus of Indiana University-Purdue University Indianapolis (IUPUI) in Indianapolis, IN. Indiana University – Purdue University Indianapolis (IUPUI) is the premier urban campus of Indiana University and Purdue University in Indianapolis, Indiana. IUPUI offers more than 225 degrees in 21 different schools and has the largest number of underrepresented minorities in the Indiana University system and the largest population of graduate and professional students of any university in Indiana. The campus is located less than 3/4 of a mile from the center of downtown Indianapolis, just two blocks from the Indiana State Capitol and adjacent to White River State Park (home of the Indiana State Museum and Indianapolis Zoo). [/fusion_text][fusion_title margin_top="30px" margin_bottom="20px" hide_on_mobile="small-visibility,medium-visibility,large-visibility" class="" id="" size="2" content_align="left" style_type="default" sep_color=""] Getting Around [/fusion_title][fusion_text]
The Institute will take place on the campus of Indiana University-Purdue University Indianapolis (IUPUI) adjacent to downtown Indianapolis. With a compact campus and easy biking pathways, we encourage you to consider using the Indiana Pacers Bikeshare, which has stations across the city including one at our campus center. You can also easily rent a Zipcar to get to locations around town. During day, you should anticipate a 10 minute walk between our various locations. There is no local campus shuttle.
[/fusion_text][fusion_title margin_top="30px" margin_bottom="20px" hide_on_mobile="small-visibility,medium-visibility,large-visibility" class="" id="" size="2" content_align="left" style_type="default" sep_color=""] Getting Here [/fusion_title][fusion_text] IUPUI is located on the west side of downtown Indianapolis, Indiana next to the Indianapolis Zoo and White River State Park. [/fusion_text][fusion_title margin_top="0" margin_bottom="10px" hide_on_mobile="small-visibility,medium-visibility,large-visibility" class="" id="" size="3" content_align="left" style_type="default" sep_color=""] From the Indianapolis Airport (Code: IND) [/fusion_title][fusion_title margin_top="0" margin_bottom="20px" hide_on_mobile="small-visibility,medium-visibility,large-visibility" class="" id="" size="4" content_align="left" style_type="default" sep_color=""] Public Transit [/fusion_title][fusion_text] IndyGo’s local service Route 8 offers public transportation between downtown Indianapolis and the Indianapolis International Airport. Airport customers can board Indianapolis Public Transportation at the Airport’s Ground Transportation Center, Zone 6. Approximate travel time between downtown and the Airport is 45 minutes with a cost of $1.75 (exact fare needed). Route 8 service on the weekdays is every 15 minutes Monday through Friday 7 a.m. – 7 p.m. It is every 30 minutes from 6 a.m. – 7 p.m. and drops to 70 minutes until midnight on weekends. [/fusion_text][fusion_title margin_top="0" margin_bottom="20px" hide_on_mobile="small-visibility,medium-visibility,large-visibility" class="" id="" size="4" content_align="left" style_type="default" sep_color=""] Driving Directions [/fusion_title][fusion_text]

From the Northwest (Chicago, IL)

Take I-65 South to Exit #114, which is West Street/Martin Luther King Blvd (SR 421). Take West Street South through the 10th, 9th and Saint Clair St. and Indiana Avenue intersections, to Michigan Street and turn Right (one-way West). Follow the  instructions below once you get to campus.

From the North

Take Meridian Street South (SR 31) to downtown Indianapolis. Turn Right onto Michigan Street (one-way West), it will take you to campus! (Pass through Illinois St., Capitol, Senate and Indiana Ave., and West Street intersections.) Follow the instructions below once you get to campus. From the Northeast/East (Columbus, OH)  Take I-465 South on the east side of town to I-70 West. As you come into town take the I-65 North exit to Chicago, IL (right lane, near Meridian St.), then move into the far Left Lane and take Exit #114 to West Street/Martin Luther King Blvd. Take West Street South through the 10th St., 9th St., St. Clair St. and Indiana Avenue intersections, and turn Right onto Michigan St. (one-way West). Follow the instructions below once you get to campus.

From the Southeast/South (Louisville, KY)

Take I-65 North downtown and take the I-70 West ramp (to St. Louis, MO). Then take Exit #79A, which is West Street/Missouri Street. Travel North through the McCarty, Merrill, South, Maryland, Washington, Ohio, and New York Street intersections to Michigan Street and turn Left (one-way West). Follow the instructions below once you get to campus. From the Airport or Southwest/West (St. Louis, MO) Travel East on I-70 East to Exit #79A, which is West Street/Missouri Street. Travel North through McCarty, Merrill, South, Maryland, Washington, Ohio, and New York Street(s) to Michigan Street and turn Left (one-way West). Follow the once you get to campus instructions below. [/fusion_text][fusion_title margin_top="0" margin_bottom="20px" hide_on_mobile="small-visibility,medium-visibility,large-visibility" class="" id="" size="4" content_align="left" style_type="default" sep_color=""] Once You Get To Campus [/fusion_title][fusion_text]
  • Michigan Street is a one way (heading west) that serves as the main campus artery.
  • Hine Hall is located just past the second road on your right. To get to Hine Hall parking, turn right onto Blake Road (preceeding Hine Hall just past the North Street Garage). The Hine Hall parking garage will be on your immediate left.
  • From the parking garage, proceed to street level onto Michigan Ave. Go west (following the flow of traffic) to the entrance of Tower Hall at the corner of University Avenue and Michigan Ave.
  • Registration for housing is located in the central lobby of Tower Hall (Sunday 3-9 pm). After 9 pm, the building doors are locked and you will need to call for access.
  • Registration for HILT is  located in the lobby outside of the Tower Hall Dining Hall (Monday 7-8:45 am). THIS IS YOUR FIRST STOP MONDAY MORNING AS YOU WILL NOT BE ABLE TO GET BREAKFAST OR ACCESS YOUR CLASS WITHOUT YOUR HILT BADGE.
[/fusion_text][fusion_title margin_top="30px" margin_bottom="20px" hide_on_mobile="small-visibility,medium-visibility,large-visibility" class="" id="maps" size="2" content_align="left" style_type="default" sep_color=""] Maps + Locations [/fusion_title][fusion_builder_row_inner][fusion_builder_column_inner type="1_2" layout="1_2" spacing="" center_content="no" hover_type="none" link="" min_height="" hide_on_mobile="small-visibility,medium-visibility,large-visibility" class="" id="" background_color="" background_image="" background_position="left top" background_repeat="no-repeat" border_size="0" border_color="" border_style="solid" padding="" dimension_margin="" animation_type="" animation_direction="left" animation_speed="0.3" animation_offset="" last="no" border_position="all"][fusion_text] Indianapolis Downtown Breweries and Distilleries Downtown Restaurants Downtown Independent Restaurants Map [/fusion_text][/fusion_builder_column_inner][fusion_builder_column_inner type="1_2" layout="1_2" spacing="" center_content="no" hover_type="none" link="" min_height="" hide_on_mobile="small-visibility,medium-visibility,large-visibility" class="" id="" background_color="" background_image="" background_position="left top" background_repeat="no-repeat" border_size="0" border_color="" border_style="solid" padding="" dimension_margin="" animation_type="" animation_direction="left" animation_speed="0.3" animation_offset="" last="no" border_position="all"][fusion_lightbox type="" full_image="http://dhtraining.org/hilt/wp-content/uploads/HILT-2016-Location-Map.jpg" video_url="" thumbnail_image="http://dhtraining.org/hilt/wp-content/uploads/HILT-2016-Location-Map-300x136.jpg" alt_text="" description="" class="" id=""][/fusion_lightbox][/fusion_builder_column_inner][/fusion_builder_row_inner][fusion_title margin_top="30px" margin_bottom="20px" hide_on_mobile="small-visibility,medium-visibility,large-visibility" class="" id="" size="2" content_align="left" style_type="default" sep_color=""] Accommodations [/fusion_title][fusion_text] Note on housing during the week of July 27-31, 2015: Indianapolis will be hosting the Brickyard 400 on the Sunday prior (the 26th) as well as the Gen Con Gaming Convention (Thursday, July 30- August 2). As such, local hotels may be difficult to book. IUPUI will assign HILT participants who elect to stay in dormitory housing to the Tower Living apartments. Please be aware that dormitories are no-frills accommodations and require you to walk to the classroom buildings. It is expected that participants electing to stay in dormitory housing recognize this aspect of their stay. Pro-rating of dormitory stays are not possible. [/fusion_text][fusion_title margin_top="" margin_bottom="20px" hide_on_mobile="small-visibility,medium-visibility,large-visibility" class="" id="" size="3" content_align="left" style_type="default" sep_color=""] Hotels [/fusion_title][fusion_text] Indianapolis is a major convention, leisure, and sporting destination and has lots of great places to stay. But because downtown stays so busy, it pays to plan ahead! This is especially true as Indianapolis will be hosting the Brickyard 400 on the Sunday prior (the 26th) as well as the Gen Con Gaming Convention (Thursday, July 30- August 2). As such, local hotels may be difficult to book. HILT is not affiliated with the businesses contained in this listing nor are we able to negotiate any special rates. This listing is provided as a courtesy only. [/fusion_text][fusion_table]
Candlewood Suites City Centre 1152 N. White River Parkway, West Drive Indianapolis, IN 46222 (317) 536-7700 The Alexander-A Dolce Hotel 333 South Delaware Street Indianapolis, IN 46204 317-624-8200
Courtyard Indianapolis Downtown 601 West Washington Street Indianapolis, Indiana 46204 (317) 822-9029 Residence Inn Downtown on the Canal 350 W New York St Indianapolis, Indiana 46202 (317) 822-0840
Fairfield Inn & Suites Indianapolis Downtown 501 West Washington Street Indianapolis, Indiana 46204 (317) 636-7678 Courtyard by Marriott Downtown Indianapolis, at the Capitol 320 N Senate Ave Indianapolis, Indiana 46202 (317) 684-7733
Crowne Plaza Hotel at Historic Union Station 123 W. Louisiana Street Indianapolis, IN 46225 (317) 631-2221 Nestle Inn 637 N East St Indianapolis, IN 46202 317-610-5200
Hampton Inn Downtown 105 S. Meridian Street Indianapolis, IN 46225 (317) 261-1200 Hilton Garden Inn Indianapolis Downtown 10 East Market Street Indianapolis, IN 46204 (317) 955-9700
Holiday Inn Express Hotel & Suites City Centre 410 S. Missouri Street Indianapolis, IN 46225 (317) 822-6400 Hyatt Regency Indianapolis Connected to Circle Center Mall One South Capitol Avenue Indianapolis, IN 46204 (317) 632-1234
Park Place City Centre 1150 N. White River Parkway, West Drive Indianapolis, IN 46222 (317) 829-1200 Indianapolis Marriott Downtown 350 West Maryland Street Indianapolis, IN 46225 (317) 822-3500
Radisson Hotel Indianapolis Airport 2500 S. High School Rd Indianapolis, IN 46241 (317) 244-3361 Spring Hill Suites Indianapolis Downtown 601 West Washington Street Indianapolis, Indiana 46204 (317) 972-7293
[/fusion_table][fusion_menu_anchor name="dorm_info" class="" /][fusion_title margin_top="40px" margin_bottom="20px" hide_on_mobile="small-visibility,medium-visibility,large-visibility" class="" id="" size="3" content_align="left" style_type="default" sep_color=""] Roommate Selection [/fusion_title][fusion_text]Participants are welcome to provide the name of a preferred roommate when booking their housing. We will do our best to accommodate roommate preference. Questions on dormitory housing can be directed to dhtraining01@gmail.com.[/fusion_text][fusion_title margin_top="" margin_bottom="20px" hide_on_mobile="small-visibility,medium-visibility,large-visibility" class="" id="" size="3" content_align="left" style_type="default" sep_color=""]Dormitory Info: The Tower Apartments[/fusion_title][fusion_text] The Tower, located in the heart of the IUPUI campus at 850 W. Michigan St, will feature double occupancy rooms with on-suite bath. The Tower Apartments are a 5 minute walk to the classroom buildings and a 10-15 minute walk to special event locations. Tower furnishings include:
  • twin-size bed
  • desk
  • chair
  • dresser
All dormitory rooms are non-smoking. You will be provided with clean linens to make your own bed, access to the Tower fitness room, as well as breakfast and lunch in our campus dining hall. Parking passes are an additional $45 per car for the week. Dormitory Location: Tower Hall (corner of University Blvd and Michigan). The registration desk is located on the first floor of the building in the central lobby. Check in hours: 3:00 – 6:00 pm 3pm to 9 pm check in procedure: You will proceed to the registration desk in Tower Hall. If the desk is not occupied,  information on who to call when you arrive will be waiting for you. The RA on duty will meet you at the desk to get you into your dorm room. 9 pm to 1 am procedure: Please note the building doors lock at 9 pm thus entrance after 9 pm is by calling for access. The phone number will be posted on the front doors at Michigan Avenue and University Avenue. You will be met at those same doors at the corner of Michigan Avenue and University Avenue to be let into the building for registration. When you check in you will be given access to your assigned room, and access to the Tower fitness room with a small set of cardio machines and free weights. Each room will have a linen package that includes: 1 blanket, 1 flat sheet, 1 fitted sheet, 1 pillow, 1 pillow case, 1 bath towel, 1 hand towel, 1 washcloth, 1 bathmat. Shower curtain and toilet paper in each bathroom will be provided. The linen packets will be placed in each room prior to Check-In. Conference participants will make their own beds. We encourage you to bring an extra blanket or your own pillow for added comfort and familiarity. Please note that no toiletries such as soap, shampoo, and conditioner are not included. We also encourage you to bring a plastic glass or water bottle as well as any other accessories you might need for your stay. Each room has individually controlled air-conditioning units. There is an ice machine on the 8th floor. When you are on the floor you get off the elevator and make a left. It is the first room on the left. There are wall sconces and lamps included in the room. The nearest parking location to the Tower Hall Residences is the Hine Hall Parking Garage located adjacent to Tower and Hine Halls. As an FYI, Tower and Hine Hall are attached to one another via a short glassed walkway. Wifi credentials, NIFTS passes, meal passes, parking passes, and your HILT badge will be provided at the HILT registration desk outside Tower Dining Hall from 7:00 – 8:45 am Monday. [fusion_builder_container admin_label="" hundred_percent="no" equal_height_columns="no" menu_anchor="" hide_on_mobile="small-visibility,medium-visibility,large-visibility" class="" id="" background_color="" background_image="" background_position="center center" background_repeat="no-repeat" fade="no" background_parallax="none" enable_mobile="no" parallax_speed="0.3" video_mp4="" video_webm="" video_ogv="" video_url="" video_aspect_ratio="16:9" video_loop="yes" video_mute="yes" video_preview_image="" border_size="" border_color="" border_style="solid" margin_top="" margin_bottom="" padding_top="" padding_right="" padding_bottom="100px" padding_left=""][fusion_builder_row][fusion_builder_column type="1_1" layout="1_1" background_position="left top" background_color="" border_size="" border_color="" border_style="solid" border_position="all" spacing="yes" background_image="" background_repeat="no-repeat" padding_top="" padding_right="" padding_bottom="" padding_left="" margin_top="0px" margin_bottom="0px" class="" id="" animation_type="" animation_speed="0.3" animation_direction="left" hide_on_mobile="small-visibility,medium-visibility,large-visibility" center_content="no" last="no" min_height="" hover_type="none" link=""][fusion_text]This year, we are offering a number of special events for attendees at HILT 2016. We are delighted to announce the following:[/fusion_text][/fusion_builder_column][fusion_builder_column type="1_1" layout="1_1" spacing="" center_content="no" hover_type="none" link="" min_height="" hide_on_mobile="small-visibility,medium-visibility,large-visibility" class="" id="" background_color="" background_image="" background_position="left top" undefined="" background_repeat="no-repeat" border_size="1" border_color="#bababa" border_style="solid" border_position="bottom" padding_top="" padding_right="" padding_bottom="" padding_left="" margin_top="" margin_bottom="" animation_type="" animation_direction="left" animation_speed="0.3" animation_offset="" last="no"][fusion_title margin_top="10px" margin_bottom="5px" hide_on_mobile="small-visibility,medium-visibility,large-visibility" class="" id="" size="2" content_align="left" style_type="default" sep_color=""]Community Keynotes[/fusion_title][fusion_title margin_top="0" margin_bottom="20px" hide_on_mobile="small-visibility,medium-visibility,large-visibility" class="" id="" size="3" content_align="left" style_type="default" sep_color=""]Monday  |  5:00 – 6:00 pm[/fusion_title][fusion_text]You are our keynote speakers for HILT. We love hearing from the community of HILT attendees what you are working on or thinking about so we’ll be holding an Ignite-style evening of short presentations on Monday, June 13. Five minutes, 20 slides maximum, all designed to get others excited about an idea, a project, a theory, an experience, or just you. In keeping with the spirit of Ignite events, we ask that presenters keep these talks short and engaging. Each presenter will have 5 minutes on stage. Each presentation will consist of 20 slides, with each slide advancing automatically every 15 seconds. For more information on the Ignite format, see: igniteannarbor.com/?p=29 We will provide laptop, digital projector, and microphone. If you’d like to participate, please email your slides your slides to trevor.munoz@gmail.com, with the subject line “[HILT IGNITE]” no later than 3:00 pm on Monday, June 13.[/fusion_text][/fusion_builder_column][fusion_builder_column type="1_1" layout="1_1" spacing="" center_content="no" hover_type="none" link="" min_height="" hide_on_mobile="small-visibility,medium-visibility,large-visibility" class="" id="" background_color="" background_image="" background_position="left top" undefined="" background_repeat="no-repeat" border_size="1" border_color="#bababa" border_style="solid" border_position="bottom" padding_top="" padding_right="" padding_bottom="" padding_left="" margin_top="" margin_bottom="" animation_type="" animation_direction="left" animation_speed="0.3" animation_offset="" last="no"][fusion_title margin_top="10px" margin_bottom="5px" hide_on_mobile="small-visibility,medium-visibility,large-visibility" class="" id="" size="2" content_align="left" style_type="default" sep_color=""] HILT Social [/fusion_title][fusion_title margin_top="0" margin_bottom="20px" hide_on_mobile="small-visibility,medium-visibility,large-visibility" class="" id="" size="3" content_align="left" style_type="default" sep_color=""] Monday  |  6:00 – 7:30 pm [/fusion_title][fusion_text]Staff from the Digital Humanities Cyberinfrastructure Group and Advanced Visualization lab will be on hand to show attendees around the lab. An interactive sphere, visualization cave, large-scale tiled wall display, touch table, Oculus Rift, and hand held scanner for generating 3d models will be on display. Throughout the social, refreshments will be available in the Lobby of the Information Technology Communications Complex.[/fusion_text][/fusion_builder_column][fusion_builder_column type="1_1" layout="1_1" spacing="" center_content="no" hover_type="none" link="" min_height="" hide_on_mobile="small-visibility,medium-visibility,large-visibility" class="" id="" background_color="" background_image="" background_position="left top" undefined="" background_repeat="no-repeat" border_size="1" border_color="#bababa" border_style="solid" border_position="bottom" padding_top="" padding_right="" padding_bottom="" padding_left="" margin_top="" margin_bottom="" animation_type="" animation_direction="left" animation_speed="0.3" animation_offset="" last="no"][fusion_title margin_top="10px" margin_bottom="5px" hide_on_mobile="small-visibility,medium-visibility,large-visibility" class="" id="" size="2" content_align="left" style_type="default" sep_color=""] Dine Around [/fusion_title][fusion_title margin_top="0" margin_bottom="20px" hide_on_mobile="small-visibility,medium-visibility,large-visibility" class="" id="" size="3" content_align="left" style_type="default" sep_color=""] Monday through Thursday evening [/fusion_title][fusion_text] Is this your first  time at Humanities Intensive Learning & Teaching? Are you new to Digital Humanities community? Do you just want to see more of Indianapolis? Join a small group of HILT participants at a local Indy restaurant, to make scholarly connections and begin new friendships. Dinners will happen each evening with parties meeting at the selected restaurant.  You can sign up on the Dine Arounds page. [/fusion_text][/fusion_builder_column][fusion_builder_column type="1_1" layout="1_1" spacing="" center_content="no" hover_type="none" link="" min_height="" hide_on_mobile="small-visibility,medium-visibility,large-visibility" class="" id="" background_color="" background_image="" background_position="left top" undefined="" background_repeat="no-repeat" border_size="1" border_color="#bababa" border_style="solid" border_position="bottom" padding_top="" padding_right="" padding_bottom="" padding_left="" margin_top="" margin_bottom="" animation_type="" animation_direction="left" animation_speed="0.3" animation_offset="" last="no"][fusion_title margin_top="10px" margin_bottom="20px" hide_on_mobile="small-visibility,medium-visibility,large-visibility" class="" id="" size="2" content_align="left" style_type="default" sep_color=""] Thursday Special Events [/fusion_title][fusion_text]On Thursday, June 16, HILT will be offering an optional special event for participants. This is a first-come, first-served event. Please note that all museum and historical society events do require participants to purchase an admissions ticket. To register for a tour, please select the tour of your choice when completing your HILT registration.[/fusion_text][fusion_title margin_top="10px" margin_bottom="10px" hide_on_mobile="small-visibility,medium-visibility,large-visibility" class="" id="" size="3" content_align="left" style_type="default" sep_color=""] 6:00 – 9:00 pm [/fusion_title][fusion_title margin_top="0px" margin_bottom="20px" hide_on_mobile="small-visibility,medium-visibility,large-visibility" class="" id="" size="4" content_align="left" style_type="default" sep_color=""] Indianapolis Museum of Art ($18) [/fusion_title][fusion_text]Address: 4000 Michigan Rd, Indianapolis, IN 46208 Tour Topic: Digital Storytelling at the Indianapolis Museum of Art Join artist and IUPUI doctoral student Janet Panoch for a special HILT excursion at the Indianapolis Museum of Art. We will focus on digital storytelling and include the special visiting exhibit by Dutch artist Jacco Olivier featuring vibrant video animations. We will begin our tour with a light dinner at the museum cafe where local beer and wine are also available. Janet will lead HILT visitors through galleries to discuss specific works on display that demonstrate storytelling in digital art. Following our tour, guests are invited to return to the cafe for drinks and continued conversation or they may tour the remainder of the museum independently. Museum admission is $18 per person; however, accommodations may be made for a group discount.  If you are a student or attending HILT on a scholarship, contact Janet for special consideration at panoch@msn.com or 317-748-8462. Schedule:
6:00 pm Meet in the foyer of the IMA for a light dinner/drinks
6:45 – 8:15 pm Digital Storytelling tour
8:15 – 9:00 pm Free time in the museum or after tour discussion in the Cafe
[/fusion_text][fusion_separator style_type="none" hide_on_mobile="small-visibility,medium-visibility,large-visibility" class="" id="" sep_color="" top_margin="15" bottom_margin="15" border_size="0" icon="" icon_circle="" icon_circle_color="" width="" alignment="center" /][/fusion_builder_column][fusion_builder_column type="1_1" layout="1_1" spacing="" center_content="no" hover_type="none" link="" min_height="" hide_on_mobile="small-visibility,medium-visibility,large-visibility" class="" id="" background_color="" background_image="" background_position="left top" undefined="" background_repeat="no-repeat" border_size="1" border_color="#bababa" border_style="solid" border_position="bottom" padding_top="" padding_right="" padding_bottom="" padding_left="" margin_top="" margin_bottom="" animation_type="" animation_direction="left" animation_speed="0.3" animation_offset="" last="no"][fusion_title margin_top="10px" margin_bottom="20px" hide_on_mobile="small-visibility,medium-visibility,large-visibility" class="" id="" size="2" content_align="left" style_type="default" sep_color=""] Friday Special Events [/fusion_title][fusion_text]On Thursday, June 16, HILT will be offering an optional special event for participants. This is a first-come, first-served event. Please note that all museum and historical society events do require participants to purchase an admissions ticket. To register for a tour, please select the tour of your choice when completing your HILT registration.[/fusion_text][fusion_title margin_top="10px" margin_bottom="10px" hide_on_mobile="small-visibility,medium-visibility,large-visibility" class="" id="" size="3" content_align="left" style_type="default" sep_color=""] 9:00 am – Noon [/fusion_title][fusion_title margin_top="0px" margin_bottom="20px" hide_on_mobile="small-visibility,medium-visibility,large-visibility" class="" id="" size="4" content_align="left" style_type="default" sep_color=""] The Children's Museum of Indianapolis ($0) [/fusion_title][fusion_text]Address: 3000 N Meridian St, Indianapolis, IN 46208 Take a behind-the-scenes tour of the extraordinary permanent collection housed at The Children’s Museum of Indianapolis! You’ll have the chance to hear from the museum’s Collections Manager and Social Media Manager as they share the many ways they’ve collaborated to bring the museum’s collection of 120,000+ objects to new audiences through social media and the web. Learn how the Collections Department and Social Media Team have established a model for “Digital Engagement Projects,” using Tumblr, Instagram, Wikipedia, and more to bring new life to the museum’s 120,000+ objects. Participants are welcome to stay at the museum until our 5 pm closing! Participants should plan to use personal or public transit to get to the museum as it is not walkable from the IUPUI campus. The Children’s Museum has graciously sponsored your attendance at this special event. To join this tour, find Jen or Trevor by lunch wednesday to register.[/fusion_text][fusion_title margin_top="10px" margin_bottom="20px" hide_on_mobile="small-visibility,medium-visibility,large-visibility" class="" id="" size="3" content_align="left" style_type="default" sep_color=""] Indianapolis Museum of Art ($18) [/fusion_title][fusion_text]Address: 4000 Michigan Rd, Indianapolis, IN 46208 Tour Topic:  Over the past few years, the Indianapolis Museum of Art has integrated digital interpretive tools in featured exhibitions and the museum galleries. You will have the chance to tour the galleries to see examples as well as learn about the development process for these tools with curators and staff from the Museum.[/fusion_text][fusion_title margin_top="10px" margin_bottom="10px" hide_on_mobile="small-visibility,medium-visibility,large-visibility" class="" id="" size="3" content_align="left" style_type="default" sep_color=""] 9:30 am – Noon [/fusion_title][fusion_title margin_top="0px" margin_bottom="20px" hide_on_mobile="small-visibility,medium-visibility,large-visibility" class="" id="" size="4" content_align="left" style_type="default" sep_color=""] HILT+ Workshop [/fusion_title][fusion_text] HILT is about learning PLUS teaching. To make HILT successful, we work hard to recruit outstanding digital humanities scholars who are already also strong teachers. At the same time, a four-day summer intensive course on digital skills is an unusual genre to tackle and we’d love to help more talented digital humanists feel confident taking on this challenge so they can share what they know. This working session will focus on the question of what makes for a good summer institute course and what are the most successful strategies for teaching one. Let’s discuss and then get down to work on capturing a first draft of our collective know-how about how to design and teach such classes. Everyone is welcome—instructors and students. [/fusion_text][fusion_title margin_top="10px" margin_bottom="10px" hide_on_mobile="small-visibility,medium-visibility,large-visibility" class="" id="" size="3" content_align="left" style_type="default" sep_color=""] 9:45 am – Noon [/fusion_title][fusion_title margin_top="0px" margin_bottom="20px" hide_on_mobile="small-visibility,medium-visibility,large-visibility" class="" id="" size="4" content_align="left" style_type="default" sep_color=""] Indiana History Society ($7) [/fusion_title][fusion_text]Address: 450 W Ohio St, Indianapolis, IN 46202 This tour is walkable from IUPUI Campus.[/fusion_text][/fusion_builder_column][/fusion_builder_row][/fusion_builder_container]

item.title: Dates + Costs
item.dc:creator: kirstenkeister
item.content:encoded:
[fusion_builder_container hundred_percent="no" equal_height_columns="no" menu_anchor="" hide_on_mobile="small-visibility,medium-visibility,large-visibility" class="" id="" background_color="" background_image="" background_position="center center" background_repeat="no-repeat" fade="no" background_parallax="none" enable_mobile="no" parallax_speed="0.3" video_mp4="" video_webm="" video_ogv="" video_url="" video_aspect_ratio="16:9" video_loop="yes" video_mute="yes" video_preview_image="" border_size="" border_color="" border_style="solid" margin_top="" margin_bottom="" padding_top="" padding_right="" padding_bottom="" padding_left=""][fusion_builder_row][fusion_builder_column type="1_1" layout="1_2" spacing="" center_content="no" hover_type="none" link="" min_height="" hide_on_mobile="small-visibility,medium-visibility,large-visibility" class="" id="" background_color="" background_image="" background_position="left top" background_repeat="no-repeat" border_size="0" border_color="" border_style="solid" border_position="all" padding_top="" padding_right="" padding_bottom="" padding_left="" animation_type="" animation_direction="left" animation_speed="0.3" animation_offset="" last="no"][fusion_title margin_top="" margin_bottom="10px" hide_on_mobile="small-visibility,medium-visibility,large-visibility" class="" id="" size="2" content_align="left" style_type="none" sep_color=""] DATES [/fusion_title][fusion_text]
  • Registration: February 15, 2016 – May 10, 2016
  • Late Registration: May 10, 2016 – June 10, 2016 (dorms are unavailable during late registration)
[/fusion_text][fusion_title margin_top="30px" margin_bottom="20px" hide_on_mobile="small-visibility,medium-visibility,large-visibility" class="" id="" size="2" content_align="left" style_type="none" sep_color=""] COSTS [/fusion_title][fusion_title margin_top="" margin_bottom="20px" hide_on_mobile="small-visibility,medium-visibility,large-visibility" class="" id="" size="3" content_align="left" style_type="default" sep_color=""] Registration [/fusion_title][fusion_text]
  • Standard: $975
  • Early Career Scholars and Cultural Heritage Professionals: $775
  • Student: $550
Registration fees includes admittance to one course, the HILT Ignite and Social, and a HILT swag bag as well as breakfast and lunch in our campus dining hall. [/fusion_text][fusion_title margin_top="40px" margin_bottom="20px" hide_on_mobile="small-visibility,medium-visibility,large-visibility" class="" id="" size="3" content_align="left" style_type="default" sep_color=""] Scholarships [/fusion_title][fusion_text] This year, we are offering a number of discounts for friends of HILT: Group Discounts: Any group of 5 who register together are eligible for a 25% discount. Group Discount options are available by looking in the lower right hand side of the registration homepage. Sponsored Student Scholarships are available to full-time enrolled students, early career scholars (terminal degree within 5 years), and current employees of galleries, archives, and museums. You MUST apply for (and be notified that you have received) a scholarship prior to beginning registration. You will be provided with a registration code to complete registration to receive the scholarship discount of $250.  Adjusted fees will be $275 (students) and $525 (early career scholars or cultural heritage professionals). There are a limited number of sponsored student scholarships. They will be awarded on a rolling-basis until exhausted. Sponsored student scholarships are no longer available for 2016. Please note you cannot combine group scholarships and student scholarships. [/fusion_text][fusion_title margin_top="40px" margin_bottom="20px" hide_on_mobile="small-visibility,medium-visibility,large-visibility" class="" id="" size="3" content_align="left" style_type="default" sep_color=""] Housing [/fusion_title][fusion_text] IUPUI Campus Housing will be offered for an additional fee: Double Occupancy Room (price per person): $375 total Single Occupancy Room (price per person): $575 total ADA-compliant single occupancy room (price per person): $575 total Housing fees include access to your assigned room from Sunday, June 12 (3 pm) to Saturday, June 18 (10 am), linens, access to the dormitory fitness room, as well as breakfast and lunch in our campus dining facilities. All dormitory rooms are non-smoking. For more information on housing including check-in procedures, please go here. [/fusion_text][fusion_title margin_top="40px" margin_bottom="20px" hide_on_mobile="small-visibility,medium-visibility,large-visibility" class="" id="" size="3" content_align="left" style_type="default" sep_color=""] Parking [/fusion_title][fusion_text]
Discounted parking passes are available for the week of the event at a cost of $48 per pass. Parking passes are for the full week only and cannot be rebated.
[/fusion_text][/fusion_builder_column][fusion_builder_column type="1_1" layout="1_1" spacing="" center_content="no" hover_type="none" link="" min_height="" item.title: Logistics
item.dc:creator: kirstenkeister
item.content:encoded:
[fusion_builder_container hundred_percent="no" equal_height_columns="no" menu_anchor="" hide_on_mobile="small-visibility,medium-visibility,large-visibility" class="" id="" background_color="" background_image="" background_position="center center" background_repeat="no-repeat" fade="no" background_parallax="none" enable_mobile="no" parallax_speed="0.3" video_mp4="" video_webm="" video_ogv="" video_url="" video_aspect_ratio="16:9" video_loop="yes" video_mute="yes" video_preview_image="" border_size="" border_color="" border_style="solid" margin_top="" margin_bottom="" padding_top="" padding_right="" padding_bottom="" padding_left=""][fusion_builder_row][fusion_builder_column type="1_1" layout="1_1" spacing="" center_content="no" hover_type="none" link="" min_height="" hide_on_mobile="small-visibility,medium-visibility,large-visibility" class="" id="" background_color="" background_image="" background_position="left top" undefined="" background_repeat="no-repeat" border_size="0" border_color="" border_style="solid" border_position="all" padding_top="" padding_right="" padding_bottom="" padding_left="" margin_top="0" margin_bottom="0" animation_type="" animation_direction="left" animation_speed="0.3" animation_offset="" last="no"][fusion_text] HILT2016 will take place on the campus of Indiana University-Purdue University Indianapolis (IUPUI) in Indianapolis, IN. Indiana University – Purdue University Indianapolis (IUPUI) is the premier urban campus of Indiana University and Purdue University in Indianapolis, Indiana. IUPUI offers more than 225 degrees in 21 different schools and has the largest number of underrepresented minorities in the Indiana University system and the largest population of graduate and professional students of any university in Indiana. The campus is located less than 3/4 of a mile from the center of downtown Indianapolis, just two blocks from the Indiana State Capitol and adjacent to White River State Park (home of the Indiana State Museum and Indianapolis Zoo). [/fusion_text][fusion_title margin_top="30px" margin_bottom="20px" hide_on_mobile="small-visibility,medium-visibility,large-visibility" class="" id="" size="2" content_align="left" style_type="default" sep_color=""] Getting Around [/fusion_title][fusion_text]The Institute will take place on the campus of Indiana University-Purdue University Indianapolis (IUPUI) adjacent to downtown Indianapolis. With a compact campus and easy biking pathways, we encourage you to consider using the Indiana Pacers Bikeshare, which has stations across the city including one at our campus center. You can also easily rent a Zipcar to get to locations around town. During day, you should anticipate a 10 minute walk between our various locations. There is no local campus shuttle.[/fusion_text][fusion_title margin_top="30px" margin_bottom="20px" hide_on_mobile="small-visibility,medium-visibility,large-visibility" class="" id="" size="2" content_align="left" style_type="default" sep_color=""] Getting Here [/fusion_title][fusion_text] IUPUI is located on the west side of downtown Indianapolis, Indiana next to the Indianapolis Zoo and White River State Park. [/fusion_text][fusion_title margin_top="0" margin_bottom="10px" hide_on_mobile="small-visibility,medium-visibility,large-visibility" class="" id="" size="3" content_align="left" style_type="default" sep_color=""] From the Indianapolis Airport (Code: IND) [/fusion_title][fusion_title margin_top="0" margin_bottom="20px" hide_on_mobile="small-visibility,medium-visibility,large-visibility" class="" id="" size="4" content_align="left" style_type="default" sep_color=""] Public Transit [/fusion_title][fusion_text] IndyGo’s local service Route 8 offers public transportation between downtown Indianapolis and the Indianapolis International Airport. Airport customers can board Indianapolis Public Transportation at the Airport’s Ground Transportation Center, Zone 6. Approximate travel time between downtown and the Airport is 45 minutes with a cost of $1.75 (exact fare needed). Route 8 service on the weekdays is every 15 minutes Monday through Friday 7 a.m. – 7 p.m. It is every 30 minutes from 6 a.m. – 7 p.m. and drops to 70 minutes until midnight on weekends. [/fusion_text][fusion_title margin_top="0" margin_bottom="20px" hide_on_mobile="small-visibility,medium-visibility,large-visibility" class="" id="" size="4" content_align="left" style_type="default" sep_color=""] Driving Directions [/fusion_title][fusion_text]

From the Northwest (Chicago, IL)

Take I-65 South to Exit #114, which is West Street/Martin Luther King Blvd (SR 421). Take West Street South through the 10th, 9th and Saint Clair St. and Indiana Avenue intersections, to Michigan Street and turn Right (one-way West). Follow the  instructions below once you get to campus.

From the North

Take Meridian Street South (SR 31) to downtown Indianapolis. Turn Right onto Michigan Street (one-way West), it will take you to campus! (Pass through Illinois St., Capitol, Senate and Indiana Ave., and West Street intersections.) Follow the instructions below once you get to campus. From the Northeast/East (Columbus, OH)  Take I-465 South on the east side of town to I-70 West. As you come into town take the I-65 North exit to Chicago, IL (right lane, near Meridian St.), then move into the far Left Lane and take Exit #114 to West Street/Martin Luther King Blvd. Take West Street South through the 10th St., 9th St., St. Clair St. and Indiana Avenue intersections, and turn Right onto Michigan St. (one-way West). Follow the instructions below once you get to campus.

From the Southeast/South (Louisville, KY)

Take I-65 North downtown and take the I-70 West ramp (to St. Louis, MO). Then take Exit #79A, which is West Street/Missouri Street. Travel North through the McCarty, Merrill, South, Maryland, Washington, Ohio, and New York Street intersections to Michigan Street and turn Left (one-way West). Follow the instructions below once you get to campus. From the Airport or Southwest/West (St. Louis, MO) Travel East on I-70 East to Exit #79A, which is West Street/Missouri Street. Travel North through McCarty, Merrill, South, Maryland, Washington, Ohio, and New York Street(s) to Michigan Street and turn Left (one-way West). Follow the once you get to campus instructions below. [/fusion_text][fusion_title margin_top="30px" margin_bottom="20px" hide_on_mobile="small-visibility,medium-visibility,large-visibility" class="" id="" size="2" content_align="left" style_type="default" sep_color=""] Parking [/fusion_title][fusion_text] Parking garages are available on campus. The nearest parking garage to our breakfast and lunch location is the Vermont Garage on Vermont Street. The nearest parking garage to our class locations are the North Street parking Garage. The nearest parking garage to our dormitory location is the Hine Hall parking garage. For those who have purchased their week-long parking pass from HILT, you will park in any of the garages listed above, taking a ticket when you enter. When you check in at registration monday morning, you will be given a replacement pass that can be used to get into and out of the parking garage without incurring additional fees. View the campus visitor’s parking map to identify your parking location. [/fusion_text][fusion_title margin_top="30px" margin_bottom="20px" hide_on_mobile="small-visibility,medium-visibility,large-visibility" class="" id="" size="2" content_align="left" style_type="default" sep_color=""] Maps + Locations [/fusion_title][fusion_builder_row_inner][fusion_builder_column_inner type="1_2" layout="1_2" spacing="" center_content="no" hover_type="none" Independent Restaurants Map[/fusion_text][/fusion_builder_column_inner][fusion_builder_column_inner type="1_2" layout="1_2" spacing="" center_content="no" hover_type="none" link="" min_height="" id=""][/fusion_lightbox][/fusion_builder_column_inner][/fusion_builder_row_inner][fusion_title margin_top="30px" margin_bottom="20px" hide_on_mobile="small-visibility,medium-visibility,large-visibility" class="" id="" size="2" content_align="left" style_type="default" sep_color=""] Accommodations [/fusion_title][fusion_text] IUPUI will assign HILT participants who elect to stay in dormitory housing. Please be aware that dormitories are no-frills accommodations and require you to walk to the classroom buildings. It is expected that participants electing to stay in dormitory housing recognize this aspect of their stay. Pro-rating of dormitory stays are not possible. [/fusion_text][fusion_title margin_top="" margin_bottom="20px" hide_on_mobile="small-visibility,medium-visibility,large-visibility" class="" id="" size="3" content_align="left" style_type="default" sep_color=""] Hotels [/fusion_title][fusion_text] Indianapolis is a major convention, leisure, and sporting destination and has lots of great places to stay. But because downtown stays so busy, it pays to plan ahead! This is especially true as Indianapolis will be hosting the Brickyard 400 on the Sunday prior (the 26th) as well as the Gen Con Gaming Convention (Thursday, July 30- August 2). As such, local hotels may be difficult to book. HILT is not affiliated with the businesses contained in this listing nor are we able to negotiate any special rates. This listing is provided as a courtesy only. [/fusion_text][fusion_table]
Candlewood Suites City Centre 1152 N. White River Parkway, West Drive Indianapolis, IN 46222 (317) 536-7700 The Alexander-A Dolce Hotel 333 South Delaware Street Indianapolis, IN 46204 317-624-8200
Courtyard Indianapolis Downtown 601 West Washington Street Indianapolis, Indiana 46204 (317) 822-9029 Residence Inn Downtown on the Canal 350 W New York St Indianapolis, Indiana 46202 (317) 822-0840
Fairfield Inn & Suites Indianapolis Downtown 501 West Washington Street Indianapolis, Indiana 46204 (317) 636-7678 Courtyard by Marriott Downtown Indianapolis, at the Capitol 320 N Senate Ave Indianapolis, Indiana 46202 (317) 684-7733
Crowne Plaza Hotel at Historic Union Station 123 W. Louisiana Street Indianapolis, IN 46225 (317) 631-2221 Nestle Inn 637 N East St Indianapolis, IN 46202 317-610-5200
Hampton Inn Downtown 105 S. Meridian Street Indianapolis, IN 46225 (317) 261-1200 Hilton Garden Inn Indianapolis Downtown 10 East Market Street Indianapolis, IN 46204 (317) 955-9700
Holiday Inn Express Hotel & Suites City Centre 410 S. Missouri Street Indianapolis, IN 46225 (317) 822-6400 Hyatt Regency Indianapolis Connected to Circle Center Mall One South Capitol Avenue Indianapolis, IN 46204 (317) 632-1234
Park Place City Centre 1150 N. White River Parkway, West Drive Indianapolis, IN 46222 (317) 829-1200 Indianapolis Marriott Downtown 350 West Maryland Street Indianapolis, IN 46225 (317) 822-3500
Radisson Hotel Indianapolis Airport 2500 S. High School Rd Indianapolis, IN 46241 (317) 244-3361 Spring Hill Suites Indianapolis Downtown 601 West Washington Street Indianapolis, Indiana 46204 (317) 972-7293
[/fusion_table][fusion_menu_anchor name="dorm_info" class="" /][fusion_title margin_top="40px" margin_bottom="20px" hide_on_mobile="small-visibility,medium-visibility,large-visibility" class="" id="" size="3" content_align="left" style_type="default" sep_color=""] Roommate Selection [/fusion_title][fusion_text]Participants are welcome to provide the name of a preferred roommate when booking their housing. We will do our best to accommodate roommate preference. Questions on dormitory housing can be directed to dhtraining01@gmail.com.[/fusion_text][fusion_title margin_top="" margin_bottom="20px" hide_on_mobile="small-visibility,medium-visibility,large-visibility" class="" id="" size="3" content_align="left" style_type="default" sep_color=""]Dormitory Info: The Tower Apartments[/fusion_title][fusion_text] The Tower, located in the heart of the IUPUI campus at 850 W. Michigan St, will feature double occupancy rooms with on-suite bath. The Tower Apartments are a 5 minute walk to the classroom buildings and a 10-15 minute walk to special event locations. Tower furnishings include: twin-size bed, desk, chair, dresser. All dormitory rooms are non-smoking. You will be provided with clean linens to make your own bed, access to the Tower fitness room, as well as breakfast and lunch in our campus dining hall. Parking passes are an additional $45 per car for the week. Dormitory Location Tower Hall (corner of University Blvd and Michigan). The registration desk is located on the first floor of the building in the central lobby. Dormitory desk support hours (including registration) will be: Monday – Friday: 8:00 am – 11:00pm Saturday & Sunday: 9:00 am – 11:00 pm Check In You will proceed to the registration desk in Tower Hall. If the desk is not occupied,  information on who to call when you arrive will be waiting for you. The RA on duty will meet you at the desk to get you into your dorm room. Please note the building doors lock at 9 pm thus entrance after 9 pm is by calling for access. The phone number will be posted on the front doors at Michigan Avenue and University Avenue. You will be met at those same doors at the corner of Michigan Avenue and University Avenue to be let into the building for registration if you are arriving outside of the check-in hours listed above. When you check in you will be given access to your assigned room, and access to the Tower fitness room with a small set of cardio machines and free weights. Each room will have a linen package that includes: 1 blanket, 1 flat sheet, 1 fitted sheet, 1 pillow, 1 pillow case, 1 bath towel, 1 hand towel, 1 washcloth, 1 bathmat. Shower curtain and toilet paper in each bathroom will be provided. The linen packets will be placed in each room prior to Check-In. Conference participants will make their own beds. We encourage you to bring an extra blanket or your own pillow for added comfort and familiarity. Please note that no toiletries such as soap, shampoo, and conditioner are not included. We also encourage you to bring a plastic glass or water bottle as well as any other accessories you might need for your stay. Each room has individually controlled air-conditioning units. There is an ice machine on the 8th floor. When you are on the floor you get off the elevator and make a left. It is the first room on the left. There are wall sconces and lamps included in the room. The nearest parking location to the Tower Hall Residences is the Hine Hall Parking Garage located adjacent to Tower and Hine Halls. As an FYI, Tower and Hine Hall are attached to one another via a short glassed walkway. Wifi credentials, meal passes, parking passes, and your HILT badge will be provided at the HILT registration desk. item.title: Schedule
item.dc:creator: kirstenkeister

item.content:encoded:
[fusion_builder_container admin_label="Content" hundred_percent="no" equal_height_columns="no" menu_anchor="" hide_on_mobile="small-visibility,medium-visibility,large-visibility" class="" id="" background_color="" background_image="" background_position="center center" background_repeat="no-repeat" fade="no" background_parallax="none" enable_mobile="no" parallax_speed="0.3" video_mp4="" video_webm="" video_ogv="" video_url="" video_aspect_ratio="16:9" video_loop="yes" video_mute="yes" video_preview_image="" border_size="" border_color="" border_style="solid" margin_top="0" margin_bottom="0" padding_top="" padding_right="" padding_bottom="" padding_left=""][fusion_builder_row][fusion_builder_column type="1_1" layout="1_1" spacing="" center_content="no" hover_type="none" link="" min_height="" hide_on_mobile="small-visibility,medium-visibility,large-visibility" class="" id="" background_color="" background_image="" background_position="left top" undefined="" background_repeat="no-repeat" border_size="0" border_color="" border_style="solid" border_position="all" padding_top="" padding_right="" padding_bottom="" padding_left="" margin_top="0" margin_bottom="0" animation_type="" animation_direction="left" animation_speed="0.3" animation_offset="" last="no"][fusion_title margin_top="0" margin_bottom="30px" hide_on_mobile="small-visibility,medium-visibility,large-visibility" class="" id="" size="2" content_align="left" style_type="default" sep_color=""] Transportation [/fusion_title][fusion_text] The University of Pennsylvania is located in West Philadelphia. Campus extends from 38th Street to the west, Spruce Street to the south, 34th Street to the east and Walnut Street to the north. [/fusion_text][fusion_button link="https://www.facilities.upenn.edu/maps" title="View Campus Map" target="_self" link_attributes="" alignment="left" modal="" hide_on_mobile="small-visibility,medium-visibility,large-visibility" class="" id="" color="default" button_gradient_top_color="" button_gradient_bottom_color="" button_gradient_top_color_hover="" button_gradient_bottom_color_hover="" accent_color="" accent_hover_color="" type="" bevel_color="" border_width="" size="medium" stretch="default" shape="" icon="" icon_position="left" icon_divider="no" animation_type="" animation_direction="left" animation_speed="0.3" animation_offset=""]UPenn Campus Map[/fusion_button][fusion_separator style_type="none" hide_on_mobile="small-visibility,medium-visibility,large-visibility" class="" id="" sep_color="" top_margin="15" bottom_margin="15" border_size="" icon="" icon_circle="" icon_circle_color="" width="" alignment="center" /][/fusion_builder_column][fusion_builder_column type="1_2" layout="1_1" spacing="yes" center_content="no" hover_type="none" link="" min_height="" hide_on_mobile="small-visibility,medium-visibility,large-visibility" class="" id="" background_color="" background_image="" background_position="left top" undefined="" background_repeat="no-repeat" border_size="" border_color="" border_style="solid" border_position="all" padding_top="" padding_right="" padding_bottom="" padding_left="" margin_top="0px" margin_bottom="0px" animation_type="" animation_direction="left" animation_speed="0.3" animation_offset="" last="no"][fusion_title margin_top="0" margin_bottom="0" hide_on_mobile="small-visibility,medium-visibility,large-visibility" class="" id="" size="3" content_align="left" style_type="default" sep_color=""] Airport Information [/fusion_title][fusion_text] The Philadelphia International Airport is the nearest airport, located less than 10 miles from campus. [/fusion_text][fusion_title margin_top="10px" margin_bottom="0" hide_on_mobile="small-visibility,medium-visibility,large-visibility" class="" id="" size="3" content_align="left" style_type="default" sep_color=""] Airport Transportation [/fusion_title][fusion_text]
  • Public Transportation
  • Taxi ($28.50 flat rate)
  • Lyft
[/fusion_text][fusion_title margin_top="10px" margin_bottom="0" hide_on_mobile="small-visibility,medium-visibility,large-visibility" class="" id="" size="3" content_align="left" style_type="default" sep_color=""] Philly Taxi Services [/fusion_title][fusion_text]
  • OnCabs Philadelphia: 215-882-9068
  • Phila Taxi Service: 267-309-2675
  • Phila Transportation Service: 215-833-9333
  • Philadelphia Taxi: 215-225-5000
[/fusion_text][/fusion_builder_column][fusion_builder_column type="1_2" layout="1_1" spacing="yes" center_content="no" hover_type="none" link="" min_height="" hide_on_mobile="small-visibility,medium-visibility,large-visibility" class="" id="" background_color="" background_image="" background_position="left top" undefined="" background_repeat="no-repeat" border_size="" border_color="" border_style="solid" border_position="all" padding_top="" padding_right="" padding_bottom="" padding_left="" margin_top="0px" margin_bottom="0px" animation_type="" animation_direction="left" animation_speed="0.3" animation_offset="" last="no"][fusion_title margin_top="10px" margin_bottom="0" hide_on_mobile="small-visibility,medium-visibility,large-visibility" class="" id="" size="3" content_align="left" style_type="default" sep_color=""] Philly Ride-Sharing Apps [/fusion_title][fusion_text]
  • lyft.com
[/fusion_text][fusion_title margin_top="10px" margin_bottom="0" hide_on_mobile="small-visibility,medium-visibility,large-visibility" class="" id="" size="3" content_align="left" style_type="default" sep_color=""] City and Campus Bus Service [/fusion_title][fusion_text]
  • Septa (Download Septa iPhone or Android app to plan your route.)
  • Campus Bus Service
[/fusion_text][fusion_title margin_top="10px" margin_bottom="10px" hide_on_mobile="small-visibility,medium-visibility,large-visibility" class="" id="" size="3" content_align="left" style_type="default" sep_color=""] Campus Parking [/fusion_title][fusion_text] Nearby parking is available at the Penn Park Parking Lot for a $13 flat rate 4 hours and over first-come, on a first-served basis (31st & Lower Walnut Sts., Phila, PA 19104) [/fusion_text][/fusion_builder_column][fusion_builder_column type="1_1" layout="1_1" spacing="yes" center_content="no" hover_type="none" link="" min_height="" hide_on_mobile="small-visibility,medium-visibility,large-visibility" class="" id="" background_color="" background_image="" background_position="left top" undefined="" background_repeat="no-repeat" border_size="" border_color="" border_style="solid" border_position="all" padding_top="0px" padding_right="0px" padding_bottom="0" padding_left="0px" margin_top="0" margin_bottom="0" animation_type="" animation_direction="left" animation_speed="0.3" animation_offset="" last="no"][fusion_separator style_type="none" hide_on_mobile="small-visibility,medium-visibility,large-visibility" class="" id="" sep_color="" top_margin="20" bottom_margin="20" border_size="0" icon="" icon_circle="" icon_circle_color="" width="" alignment="center" /][fusion_title margin_top="0" margin_bottom="0" hide_on_mobile="small-visibility,medium-visibility,large-visibility" class="" id="" size="2" content_align="left" style_type="default" sep_color=""] Locations [/fusion_title][/fusion_builder_column][fusion_builder_column type="1_2" layout="1_1" spacing="yes" center_content="no" hover_type="none" link="" min_height="" hide_on_mobile="small-visibility,medium-visibility,large-visibility" class="" id="" background_color="" background_image="" background_position="left top" undefined="" background_repeat="no-repeat" border_size="" border_color="" border_style="solid" border_position="all" padding_top="" padding_right="" padding_bottom="" padding_left="" margin_top="0px" margin_bottom="0px" animation_type="" animation_direction="left" animation_speed="0.3" animation_offset="" last="no"][fusion_title margin_top="40px" margin_bottom="10px" hide_on_mobile="small-visibility,medium-visibility,large-visibility" class="" id="" size="3" content_align="left" style_type="default" sep_color=""] Registration [/fusion_title][fusion_text]To kick off HILT (on Monday, June 4), please join us at the Class of 1978 Pavillion on the 6th floor of the Van Pelt Library, beginning at 7:45 AM, for Breakfast, Registration, and a Welcome session.
  • Class of 1978 Pavilion (6th Floor, Van Pelt Library) 3420 Walnut St Philadelphia, PA 19104
[/fusion_text][/fusion_builder_column][fusion_builder_column type="1_2" layout="1_1" spacing="yes" center_content="no" hover_type="none" link="" min_height="" hide_on_mobile="small-visibility,medium-visibility,large-visibility" class="" id="" background_color="" background_image="" background_position="left top" undefined="" background_repeat="no-repeat" border_size="" border_color="" border_style="solid" border_position="all" padding_top="" padding_right="" padding_bottom="" padding_left="" margin_top="0px" margin_bottom="0px" animation_type="" animation_direction="left" animation_speed="0.3" animation_offset="" last="no"][fusion_title margin_top="40px" margin_bottom="10px" hide_on_mobile="small-visibility,medium-visibility,large-visibility" class="" id="" size="3" content_align="left" style_type="default" sep_color=""] Dining Location [/fusion_title][fusion_text] Breakfast and Lunch will be served in the Class of 1978 Pavilion each day.
  • Class of 1978 Pavilion (6th Floor, Van Pelt Library)
[/fusion_text][/fusion_builder_column][fusion_builder_column type="1_2" layout="1_2" spacing="" center_content="no" hover_type="none" link="" min_height="" hide_on_mobile="small-visibility,medium-visibility,large-visibility" class="" id="" background_color="" background_image="" background_position="left top" background_repeat="no-repeat" border_size="0" border_color="" border_style="solid" border_position="all" padding_top="" padding_right="" padding_bottom="" padding_left="" dimension_margin="" animation_type="" animation_direction="left" animation_speed="0.3" animation_offset="" last="no"][fusion_title margin_top="10px" margin_bottom="10px" hide_on_mobile="small-visibility,medium-visibility,large-visibility" class="" id="" size="3" content_align="left" style_type="default" sep_color=""] Classroom Locations [/fusion_title][fusion_text]HILT Classrooms are located in the Kislak Center on the 6th floor of the Van Pelt Library and in the Fisher Fine Arts Library. Course-specific classrooms assignments will be posted Sunday, June 3.
  • Kislak Center (6th Floor, Van Pelt Library)
  • Fisher Fine Arts Library 220 S 34th St Philadelphia, PA 19104
[/fusion_text][/fusion_builder_column][fusion_builder_column type="1_2" layout="1_2" spacing="" center_content="no" hover_type="none" link="" min_height="" hide_on_mobile="small-visibility,medium-visibility,large-visibility" class="" id="" background_color="" background_image="" background_position="left top" background_repeat="no-repeat" border_size="0" border_color="" border_style="solid" border_position="all" padding_top="" padding_right="" padding_bottom="" padding_left="" dimension_margin="" animation_type="" animation_direction="left" animation_speed="0.3" animation_offset="" last="no"][fusion_title margin_top="10px" margin_bottom="10px" hide_on_mobile="small-visibility,medium-visibility,large-visibility" class="" id="" size="3" content_align="left" style_type="default" sep_color=""] Walking Distances [/fusion_title][fusion_text]All HILT locations are on the Penn Campus, and are within a 5-15 minute walk of each other (besides the dine-arounds and cultural sites.) It is likely you will not need a vehicle during your stay.[/fusion_text][/fusion_builder_column][fusion_builder_column type="1_1" layout="1_1" spacing="" center_content="no" link="" target="_self" min_height="" hide_on_mobile="small-visibility,medium-visibility,large-visibility" class="" id="" background_color="" background_image="" background_position="left top" undefined="" background_repeat="no-repeat" hover_type="none" border_size="0" border_color="" border_style="solid" border_position="all" padding_top="0px" padding_right="0px" padding_bottom="0px" padding_left="0px" margin_top="0px" margin_bottom="0px" animation_type="" animation_direction="left" animation_speed="0.3" animation_offset="" last="no"][fusion_title margin_top="10px" margin_bottom="10px" hide_on_mobile="small-visibility,medium-visibility,large-visibility" class="" id="" size="3" content_align="left" style_type="default" sep_color=""] Special Events Locations [/fusion_title][fusion_table]
Ignite Talks/HILT Opening Social Reception Perry World House 3803 Locust Walk, Philadelphia, PA 19104
Other Locations TBA
