item.title: Cultural Heritage Experiences
item.dc:creator: mariahmin
item.content:encoded:
[fusion_builder_container hundred_percent="no" equal_height_columns="no" menu_anchor="" hide_on_mobile="small-visibility,medium-visibility,large-visibility" class="" id="" background_color="" background_image="" background_position="center center" background_repeat="no-repeat" fade="no" background_parallax="none" parallax_speed="0.3" video_mp4="" video_webm="" video_ogv="" video_url="" video_aspect_ratio="16:9" video_loop="yes" video_mute="yes" overlay_color="" video_preview_image="" border_size="" border_color="" border_style="solid" padding_top="" padding_bottom="" padding_left="" padding_right=""][fusion_builder_row][fusion_builder_column type="1_1" layout="1_1" background_position="left top" background_color="" border_size="" border_color="" border_style="solid" border_position="all" spacing="yes" background_image="" background_repeat="no-repeat" padding_top="" padding_right="" padding_bottom="" padding_left="" margin_top="0px" margin_bottom="0px" class="" id="" animation_type="" animation_speed="0.3" animation_direction="left" hide_on_mobile="small-visibility,medium-visibility,large-visibility" center_content="no" last="no" min_height="" hover_type="none" link=""][fusion_text] HILT participants are invited to attend special experiences on the UPenn campus and in the city of Philadelphia. Organized especially with our institute in mind, taking part in these experience also offers an opportunity to befriend fellow HILT participants outside of your classroom. [/fusion_text][/fusion_builder_column][fusion_builder_column type="1_1" layout="1_1" spacing="" center_content="no" hover_type="none" link="" min_height="" hide_on_mobile="small-visibility,medium-visibility,large-visibility" class="" id="" background_color="" background_image="" background_position="left top" undefined="" background_repeat="no-repeat" border_size="1" border_color="#bababa" border_style="solid" border_position="bottom" padding_top="" padding_right="" padding_bottom="" padding_left="" margin_top="" margin_bottom="" animation_type="" animation_direction="left" animation_speed="0.3" animation_offset="" last="no"][fusion_title margin_top="10px" margin_bottom="0" hide_on_mobile="small-visibility,medium-visibility,large-visibility" class="" id="" size="2" content_align="left" style_type="default" sep_color=""] Eastern State Penitentiary [/fusion_title][fusion_title margin_top="0" margin_bottom="30px" hide_on_mobile="small-visibility,medium-visibility,large-visibility" class="" id="" size="3" content_align="left" style_type="default" sep_color=""] Private Guided Tour [/fusion_title][fusion_text] [caption id="attachment_1924" align="alignleft" width="300"] Photo by Albert Vecerka[/caption] Friday, June 8 at 10:00 am 15 spots available Cost: $20 Eastern State Penitentiary Historic Site interprets the legacy of American criminal justice reform, from the nation’s founding through to the present day, within the long-abandoned cellblocks of the nation’s most historic prison. Participants will take a one hour, private guided tour of the ruins of Eastern State Penitentiary. Opened in 1829 and in operation until 1971, Eastern State was a revolutionary institution that claimed to be designed for reform rather than punishment. The guided portion of the tour takes around 60 minutes and during this time your group will:
  • Explore Eastern State, the world’s first true “penitentiary,” a prison designed to inspire true regret in the hearts of criminals
  • Walk the cellblocks; step inside a recreated cell
  • Examine Eastern State’s revolutionary architecture
  • Discuss the “Pennsylvania System” of separate confinement
  • Hear true escape stories
  • Contemplate the lives of inmates and guards who once called Eastern State home
  • Witness the deteriorating effects of the building’s near two decade abandonment
  • Make connections between the history of Eastern State and prisons today
After the one hour tour, participants from HILT meet with the on site archivist, Erica Harmon, for an additional hour and get a peek behind the scenes of the research wing of ESP. [/fusion_text][/fusion_builder_column][fusion_builder_column type="1_1" layout="1_1" spacing="" center_content="no" hover_type="none" link="" min_height="" hide_on_mobile="small-visibility,medium-visibility,large-visibility" class="" id="" background_color="" background_image="" background_position="left top" undefined="" background_repeat="no-repeat" border_size="1" border_color="#bababa" border_style="solid" border_position="bottom" padding_top="" padding_right="" padding_bottom="" padding_left="" margin_top="" margin_bottom="" animation_type="" animation_direction="left" animation_speed="0.3" animation_offset="" last="no"][fusion_title margin_top="10px" margin_bottom="0" hide_on_mobile="small-visibility,medium-visibility,large-visibility" class="" id="" size="2" content_align="left" style_type="default" sep_color=""]The ViDi Center[/fusion_title][fusion_title margin_top="0" margin_bottom="30px" hide_on_mobile="small-visibility,medium-visibility,large-visibility" class="" id="" size="3" content_align="left" style_type="default" sep_color=""] Introduction to Center and Discussion Session [/fusion_title][fusion_text] [caption id="attachment_1926" align="alignleft" width="300"] Visualization of David Rittenhouse's 1771 orrery by the ViDi Center[/caption] Friday, June 8 at 10:00 am Cost: $10 Through modern computer graphics, the ViDi Center for Digital Visualization addresses 3D visual experiences, reconstruction, and animation of cultural environments. This session will describe the state-of-the-art in computer visual simulations, especially as they relate to human environments that pose significant and interesting questions for the Humanities. The second half of the session will be devoted to specific case studies in natural and ancient lighting, and the re-population of prehistoric human environments. Problem areas suggested by the participants are particularly welcome for discussion. This session will be lead by Norm Badler, Rachleff Professor of Computer and Information Science. It will begin at 10am and last for 2 hours. [/fusion_text][/fusion_builder_column][fusion_builder_column type="1_1" layout="1_1" spacing="" center_content="no" hover_type="none" link="" min_height="" hide_on_mobile="small-visibility,medium-visibility,large-visibility" class="" id="" background_color="" background_image="" background_position="left top" undefined="" background_repeat="no-repeat" border_size="1" border_color="#bababa" border_style="solid" border_position="bottom" padding_top="" padding_right="" padding_bottom="" padding_left="" margin_top="" margin_bottom="" animation_type="" animation_direction="left" animation_speed="0.3" animation_offset="" last="no"][fusion_title margin_top="10px" margin_bottom="0" hide_on_mobile="small-visibility,medium-visibility,large-visibility" class="" id="" size="2" content_align="left" style_type="default" sep_color=""]Kislak Center for Special Collections, Rare Books and Manuscripts[/fusion_title][fusion_title margin_top="0" margin_bottom="30px" hide_on_mobile="small-visibility,medium-visibility,large-visibility" class="" id="" size="3" content_align="left" style_type="default" sep_color=""] Special Tour [/fusion_title][fusion_text] [caption id="attachment_1927" align="alignleft" width="300"] Photo by Greg Benson[/caption] Friday, June 8 at 10:00 am Cost: $10 The tour of the Kislak Center for Special Collections, Rare Books and Manuscripts will include a visit to the Vitale Media Lab, SCETI, and the Steven Miller Conservation Lab. The Vitale Media Lab (Vitale II) is the Book History and Digital Humanities (BH+DH) lab in the Kislak Center. Vitale II welcomes scholars of all levels who are working on projects at the intersection of BH+DH, providing space for collaboration and learning, for experimentation and creation, for people to come together to ask and answer questions. SCETI, the Schoenberg Center for Electronic Text and Image, is the library's digitization lab, where books and manuscripts are digitized for our online projects. The Steven Miller Conservation Lab, which opened in 2016, is the place where the library's collections are cared for. Led by Dot Porter, Curator of Digital Research Services, with assistance from Michael Overgard, Head of SCETI, and Sarah Reidell, Margy Meyerson Head of Conservation at the University of Pennsylvania. The tour will begin at 10am and last for approximately two hours. [/fusion_text][/fusion_builder_column][fusion_builder_column type="1_1" layout="1_1" spacing="" center_content="no" hover_type="none" link="" min_height="" hide_on_mobile="small-visibility,medium-visibility,large-visibility" class="" id="" background_color="" background_image="" background_position="left top" undefined="" background_repeat="no-repeat" border_size="0" border_color="" border_style="solid" border_position="all" padding_top="0" padding_right="0px" padding_bottom="0" padding_left="0px" margin_top="0" margin_bottom="0" animation_type="" animation_direction="left" animation_speed="0.3" animation_offset="" last="no"][fusion_title margin_top="10px" margin_bottom="0" hide_on_mobile="small-visibility,medium-visibility,large-visibility" class="" id="" size="2" content_align="left" style_type="default" sep_color=""] Monument Lab [/fusion_title][fusion_title margin_top="0" margin_bottom="30px" hide_on_mobile="small-visibility,medium-visibility,large-visibility" class="" id="" size="3" content_align="left" style_type="default" sep_color=""] Special Tour [/fusion_title][fusion_text] [caption id="attachment_1928" align="alignleft" width="300"] All Power to All People, by Hank Willis Thomas, as part of Monument Lab. Photo by Steve Weinik[/caption] Friday, June 8 at 10:00 am Cost: $10 During the fall of 2017, the city of Philadelphia was the site of a giant public art and history project called Monument Lab which asked residents of the city as well as 20 artists from around the world to answer the question “What is an appropriate monument for the current city of Philadelphia?” By the end of fall, the project had produced countless conversations, and more than 4000 individual proposals for monuments that might/should/could exist in Philadelphia as well as temporary prototype monuments around the city. Though the Labs and prototypes will be gone by June 2018, participants on this tour will visit 3-4 Monument Lab sites where temporary monuments were created or imagined, and experience immersive renderings of the artworks as they existed during the project. Based on 3d image and video captured during the project, this tour will invite participants to use various immersive technologies to explore the speculative monuments and engage in conversations with members of the curatorial and research team about the project. The tour will spend considerable time re-visiting portions of the the “Sweet Chariot” App monument developed by Marisa Williamson. “Sweet Chariot is an interactive video scavenger hunt that guides users as they uncover a series of site-specific videos that reveal hidden moments in the landscape of historic Philadelphia, opening a window onto the African American struggle for freedom. The journey begins in historic Washington Square, and invites viewers to look for clues hiding in plain sight, including images on signs, plaques, and murals. Each unlocked video presents a creative and collaborative interpretation of a story from Philadelphia's African American history. The tour will begin at 10am and last approximately 3 hours.[/fusion_text][/fusion_builder_column][fusion_builder_column type="1_1" layout="1_1" spacing="" center_content="no" hover_type="none" link="" min_height="" hide_on_mobile="small-visibility,medium-visibility,large-visibility" class="" id="" background_color="" background_image="" background_position="left top" undefined="" background_repeat="no-repeat" border_size="1" border_color="#bababa" border_style="solid" border_position="bottom" padding_top="" padding_right="" padding_bottom="" padding_left="" margin_top="" margin_bottom="" animation_type="" animation_direction="left" animation_speed="0.3" animation_offset="" last="no"][fusion_title margin_top="10px" margin_bottom="0" hide_on_mobile="small-visibility,medium-visibility,large-visibility" class="" id="" size="2" content_align="left" style_type="default" sep_color="" /][/fusion_builder_column][fusion_builder_column type="1_1" layout="1_1" spacing="" center_content="no" hover_type="none" link="" min_height="" hide_on_mobile="small-visibility,medium-visibility,large-visibility" class="" id="" background_color="" background_image="" background_position="left top" undefined="" background_repeat="no-repeat" border_size="1" border_color="#bababa" border_style="solid" border_position="bottom" padding_top="" padding_right="" padding_bottom="" padding_left="" margin_top="" margin_bottom="" animation_type="" animation_direction="left" animation_speed="0.3" animation_offset="" last="no"][fusion_title margin_top="10px" margin_bottom="0" hide_on_mobile="small-visibility,medium-visibility,large-visibility" class="" id="" size="2" content_align="left" style_type="default" sep_color=""] Penn Museum: Saving History in the Near East [/fusion_title][fusion_title margin_top="0" margin_bottom="30px" hide_on_mobile="small-visibility,medium-visibility,large-visibility" class="" id="" size="3" content_align="left" style_type="default" sep_color=""] Special Tour [/fusion_title][fusion_text] [caption id="attachment_1929" align="alignleft" width="300"] Cultures in the Crossfire exhibit[/caption] Friday, June 8 at 10:00 am 30 spots available Cost: $20 This lecture and exhibit provides a historical context for the destruction of monuments in the Near East and Central Asia (Syria, Iraq, Afghanistan). Dr. Rose also reviews the new educational programs in cultural heritage protection that involve archaeologists and the military, and highlights the cultural links between antiquity and the contemporary world. This opportunity will include a guided tour of the Cultures in the Crossfire exhibit, a behind the scenes look at the Museum’s conservation efforts in the Artifact Lab as well as a lecture from a museum curator. Tour is capped at 30 people. It will begin at 10 am and last for approximately 2 hours though participants are welcome to explore the rest of the museum on their own after the planned tour and lecture conclude. [/fusion_text][fusion_separator style_type="single solid" hide_on_mobile="small-visibility,medium-visibility,large-visibility" class="" id="" sep_color="#665c5c" top_margin="75px" bottom_margin="40px" border_size="3" icon="" icon_circle="" icon_circle_color="" width="" alignment="center" /][/fusion_builder_column][/fusion_builder_row][/fusion_builder_container][fusion_builder_container item.title: Dates + Costs
item.dc:creator: jenguiliano
item.content:encoded:
[fusion_builder_container hundred_percent="no" equal_height_columns="no" menu_anchor="" hide_on_mobile="small-visibility,medium-visibility,large-visibility" class="" id="" background_color="" background_image="" background_position="center center" background_repeat="no-repeat" fade="no" background_parallax="none" parallax_speed="0.3" video_mp4="" video_webm="" video_ogv="" video_url="" video_aspect_ratio="16:9" video_loop="yes" video_mute="yes" overlay_color="" video_preview_image="" border_size="" border_color="" border_style="solid" padding_top="" padding_bottom="" padding_left="" padding_right=""][fusion_builder_row][fusion_builder_column type="1_1" layout="1_1" background_position="left top" background_color="" border_size="" border_color="" border_style="solid" border_position="all" spacing="yes" background_image="" background_repeat="no-repeat" padding_top="" padding_right="" padding_bottom="" padding_left="" margin_top="0px" margin_bottom="0px" class="" id="" animation_type="" animation_speed="0.3" animation_direction="left" hide_on_mobile="small-visibility,medium-visibility,large-visibility" center_content="no" last="no" min_height="" hover_type="none" link=""][fusion_title margin_top="" margin_bottom="30px" hide_on_mobile="small-visibility,medium-visibility,large-visibility" class="" id="" size="2" content_align="left" style_type="none" sep_color=""] DATES [/fusion_title][fusion_text columns="" column_min_width="" column_spacing="" rule_style="default" rule_size="" rule_color="" hide_on_mobile="small-visibility,medium-visibility,large-visibility" class="" id=""]
  • Registration: November 1, 2018 – April 26, 2019
  • Late Registration: April 27, 2019 – May 24, 2019 (dorms are unavailable during late registration)
[/fusion_text][fusion_title hide_on_mobile="small-visibility,medium-visibility,large-visibility" class="" id="" content_align="left" size="2" font_size="" line_height="" letter_spacing="" margin_top="40px" margin_bottom="10px" text_color="" style_type="none" sep_color=""] COSTS [/fusion_title][fusion_title hide_on_mobile="small-visibility,medium-visibility,large-visibility" class="" id="" content_align="left" size="3" font_size="" line_height="" letter_spacing="" margin_top="40px" margin_bottom="20px" text_color="" style_type="none" sep_color=""] Registration [/fusion_title][fusion_text columns="" column_min_width="" column_spacing="" rule_style="default" rule_size="" rule_color="" hide_on_mobile="small-visibility,medium-visibility,large-visibility" class="" id=""]
  • Standard: $975
  • Early Career Scholars and Cultural Heritage Professionals: $775
  • Student: $550
Registration fees includes admittance to one course, our community event, as well as breakfast and lunch in our campus dining hall. [/fusion_text][fusion_title hide_on_mobile="small-visibility,medium-visibility,large-visibility" class="" id="" content_align="left" size="3" font_size="" line_height="" letter_spacing="" margin_top="40px" margin_bottom="20px" text_color="" style_type="none" sep_color=""] Scholarships [/fusion_title][fusion_text columns="" column_min_width="" column_spacing="" rule_style="default" rule_size="" rule_color="" hide_on_mobile="small-visibility,medium-visibility,large-visibility" class="" id=""] This year, we are offering a number of discounts for friends of HILT: Group Discounts: Any group of 5 who register together are eligible for a 25% discount. Group Discount options are available by looking in the lower right hand side of the registration homepage. Sponsored Student Scholarships are available to full-time enrolled students, early career scholars (terminal degree within 5 years), and current employees of galleries, archives, and museums. You MUST apply for (and be notified that you have received) a scholarship prior to beginning registration. You will be provided with a registration code to complete registration to receive the scholarship discount of $250.  Adjusted fees will be $275 (students) and $525 (early career scholars or cultural heritage professionals). There are a limited number of sponsored student scholarships. They will be awarded on a rolling-basis until exhausted. Please note you cannot combine group scholarships and student scholarships. Apply NOW! [/fusion_text][fusion_title hide_on_mobile="small-visibility,medium-visibility,large-visibility" class="" id="" content_align="left" size="3" font_size="" line_height="" letter_spacing="" margin_top="40px" margin_bottom="20px" text_color="" style_type="none" sep_color=""] Housing [/fusion_title][fusion_text columns="" column_min_width="" column_spacing="" rule_style="default" rule_size="" rule_color="" hide_on_mobile="small-visibility,medium-visibility,large-visibility" class="" id=""] IUPUI Campus Housing will be offered for an additional fee. Housing rates are as follows. Double Occupancy Room (price per person): $57 per night/$342 total Single Occupancy Room (price per person): $108 per night/$648 total ADA-compliant single occupancy room (price per person): $108 per night/$648 total Housing fees include access to your assigned room from Sunday, June 2 (3 pm) to Saturday, June 8 (10 am), linens, as well as breakfast and lunch in our campus dining facilities. All dormitory rooms are non-smoking. Please be aware that dormitories are no-frills accommodations and require you to walk to the classroom buildings. It is expected that participants electing to stay in dormitory housing recognize this aspect of their stay. Pro-rating of dormitory stays are not possible. University Tower is modern residence hall is located in the heart of the IUPUI campus. Amenities for double rooms:
  • Twin XL beds, contemporary furnishings
  • Full attached bathroom
  • In-room temperature control
  • Free wireless Internet
[/fusion_text][fusion_title hide_on_mobile="small-visibility,medium-visibility,large-visibility" class="" id="" content_align="left" size="3" font_size="" line_height="" letter_spacing="" margin_top="40px" margin_bottom="20px" text_color="" style_type="none" sep_color=""] Parking [/fusion_title][fusion_text columns="" column_min_width="" column_spacing="" rule_style="default" rule_size="" rule_color="" hide_on_mobile="small-visibility,medium-visibility,large-visibility" class="" id=""] Discounted parking passes are available for the week of the event at a cost of $56 per pass. Parking passes are for the full week only and cannot be rebated. [/fusion_text][fusion_separator style_type="default" hide_on_mobile="small-visibility,medium-visibility,large-visibility" class="" id="" sep_color="" top_margin="" bottom_margin="" border_size="" icon="" icon_circle="" icon_circle_color="" width="" alignment="center" /][fusion_text columns="" column_min_width="" column_spacing="" rule_style="default" rule_size="" rule_color="" hide_on_mobile="small-visibility,medium-visibility,large-visibility" class="" id=""] Cancellation Policy: Full refunds are available minus a $30.00 processing fee until April 27, 2019. You are able to substitute another registrant at no cost until April 27, 2019. After April 27, 2019, there are no refunds. [/fusion_text][/fusion_builder_column][/fusion_builder_row][/fusion_builder_container][fusion_global id="2137"]

item.title: Logistics
item.dc:creator: jenguiliano
item.content:encoded:
[fusion_builder_container hundred_percent="no" hundred_percent_height="no" hundred_percent_height_scroll="no" hundred_percent_height_center_content="yes" equal_height_columns="no" menu_anchor="" hide_on_mobile="small-visibility,medium-visibility,large-visibility" status="published" publish_date="" class="" id="" background_color="" background_image="" background_position="center center" background_repeat="no-repeat" fade="no" background_parallax="none" enable_mobile="no" parallax_speed="0.3" video_mp4="" video_webm="" video_ogv="" video_url="" video_aspect_ratio="16:9" video_loop="yes" video_mute="yes" video_preview_image="" border_size="" border_color="" border_style="solid" margin_top="" margin_bottom="" padding_top="" padding_right="" padding_bottom="" padding_left=""][fusion_builder_row][fusion_builder_column type="1_1" layout="1_1" spacing="" center_content="no" link="" target="_self" min_height="" hide_on_mobile="small-visibility,medium-visibility,large-visibility" class="" id="" background_image_id="" background_color="" background_image="" background_position="left top" undefined="" background_repeat="no-repeat" hover_type="none" border_size="0" border_color="" border_style="solid" border_position="all" padding_top="0" padding_right="0" padding_bottom="0" padding_left="0" margin_top="0" margin_bottom="0" animation_type="" animation_direction="left" animation_speed="0.3" animation_offset="" last="no"][fusion_title hide_on_mobile="small-visibility,medium-visibility,large-visibility" class="" id="" content_align="left" size="2" font_size="" line_height="" letter_spacing="" margin_top="0" margin_bottom="20px" text_color="" style_type="none" sep_color=""] LOCATION [/fusion_title][fusion_text] HILT 2019 will take place on the campus of Indiana University-Purdue University Indianapolis (IUPUI) in Indianapolis, IN. Indiana University – Purdue University Indianapolis (IUPUI) is the premier urban campus of Indiana University and Purdue University in Indianapolis, Indiana. IUPUI offers more than 225 degrees in 21 different schools and has the largest number of underrepresented minorities in the Indiana University system and the largest population of graduate and professional students of any university in Indiana. The campus is located less than 3/4 of a mile from the center of downtown Indianapolis, just two blocks from the Indiana State Capitol and adjacent to White River State Park (home of the Indiana State Museum and Indianapolis Zoo).[/fusion_text][fusion_title hide_on_mobile="small-visibility,medium-visibility,large-visibility" class="" id="" content_align="left" size="2" font_size="" line_height="" letter_spacing="" margin_top="40px" margin_bottom="20px" text_color="" style_type="none" sep_color=""] TRANSPORTATION [/fusion_title][fusion_text] The Institute will take place on the campus of Indiana University-Purdue University Indianapolis (IUPUI) adjacent to downtown Indianapolis. With a compact campus and easy biking pathways, we encourage you to consider using the Indiana Pacers Bikeshare, which has stations across the city including one at our campus center. You can also easily rent a Zipcar or use a Bird or Lime scooter to get to locations around town. During day, you should anticipate a 10 minute walk between our various locations. There is no local campus shuttle. [/fusion_text][fusion_title hide_on_mobile="small-visibility,medium-visibility,large-visibility" class="" id="" content_align="left" size="3" font_size="" line_height="" letter_spacing="" margin_top="40px" margin_bottom="20px" text_color="" style_type="none" sep_color=""] Airport Transportation (Indianapolis Airport Code: IND) [/fusion_title][fusion_text] IUPUI is located on the west side of downtown Indianapolis, Indiana next to the Indianapolis Zoo and White River State Park. [/fusion_text][fusion_title hide_on_mobile="small-visibility,medium-visibility,large-visibility" class="" id="" content_align="left" size="4" font_size="" line_height="" letter_spacing="" margin_top="20px" margin_bottom="20px" text_color="" style_type="default" sep_color=""] Public Transit [/fusion_title][fusion_text]IndyGo’s local service Route 8 offers public transportation between downtown Indianapolis and the Indianapolis International Airport. Airport customers can board Indianapolis Public Transportation at the Airport’s Ground Transportation Center, Zone 6. Approximate travel time between downtown and the Airport is 45 minutes with a cost of $1.75 (exact fare needed). Route 8 service on the weekdays is every 15 minutes Monday through Friday 7 a.m. – 7 p.m. It is every 30 minutes from 6 a.m. – 7 p.m. and drops to 70 minutes until midnight on weekends. [/fusion_text][fusion_title hide_on_mobile="small-visibility,medium-visibility,large-visibility" class="" id="" content_align="left" size="4" font_size="" line_height="" letter_spacing="" margin_top="20px" margin_bottom="20px" text_color="" style_type="default" sep_color=""] Driving Directions [/fusion_title][fusion_text columns="" column_min_width="" column_spacing="" rule_style="default" rule_size="" rule_color="" hide_on_mobile="small-visibility,medium-visibility,large-visibility" class="" id=""] From the Northwest (Chicago, IL) Take I-65 South to Exit #114, which is West Street/Martin Luther King Blvd (SR 421). Take West Street South through the 10th, 9th and Saint Clair St. and Indiana Avenue intersections, to Michigan Street and turn Right (one-way West). Follow the  instructions below once you get to campus. From the North Take Meridian Street South (SR 31) to downtown Indianapolis. Turn Right onto Michigan Street (one-way West), it will take you to campus! (Pass through Illinois St., Capitol, Senate and Indiana Ave., and West Street intersections.) Follow the instructions below once you get to campus. From the Northeast/East (Columbus, OH) Take I-465 South on the east side of town to I-70 West. As you come into town take the I-65 North exit to Chicago, IL (right lane, near Meridian St.), then move into the far Left Lane and take Exit #114 to West Street/Martin Luther King Blvd. Take West Street South through the 10th St., 9th St., St. Clair St. and Indiana Avenue intersections, and turn Right onto Michigan St. (one-way West). Follow the instructions below once you get to campus. From the Southeast/South (Louisville, KY) Take I-65 North downtown and take the I-70 West ramp (to St. Louis, MO). Then take Exit #79A, which is West Street/Missouri Street. Travel North through the McCarty, Merrill, South, Maryland, Washington, Ohio, and New York Street intersections to Michigan Street and turn Left (one-way West). Follow the instructions below once you get to campus. From the Airport or Southwest/West (St. Louis, MO) Travel East on I-70 East to Exit #79A, which is West Street/Missouri Street. Travel North through McCarty, Merrill, South, Maryland, Washington, Ohio, and New York Street(s) to Michigan Street and turn Left (one-way West). Follow the once you get to campus instructions below. [/fusion_text][fusion_title hide_on_mobile="small-visibility,medium-visibility,large-visibility" class="" id="" content_align="left" size="2" font_size="" line_height="" letter_spacing="" margin_top="40px" margin_bottom="20px" text_color="" style_type="default" sep_color=""] PARKING [/fusion_title][fusion_text columns="" column_min_width="" column_spacing="" rule_style="default" rule_size="" rule_color="" hide_on_mobile="small-visibility,medium-visibility,large-visibility" class="" id=""] Parking garages are available on campus. For those who have purchased their week-long parking pass from HILT, you will park in an assigned garage, taking a ticket when you enter. When you check in at registration Monday morning, you will be given a replacement pass that can be used to get into and out of the parking garage without incurring additional fees. View the campus visitor’s parking map to identify parking locations. [/fusion_text][fusion_title hide_on_mobile="small-visibility,medium-visibility,large-visibility" class="" id="" content_align="left" size="2" font_size="" line_height="" letter_spacing="" margin_top="40px" margin_bottom="20px" text_color="" style_type="none" sep_color=""] MAPS + LOCATIONS [/fusion_title][/fusion_builder_column][fusion_builder_column type="1_2" layout="1_2" spacing="4%" padding_top="0" padding_right="0" padding_bottom="0" padding_left="0" margin_top="0" margin_bottom="0" animation_type="" animation_direction="left" animation_speed="0.3" animation_offset="" last="no"][fusion_title hide_on_mobile="small-visibility,medium-visibility,large-visibility" class="" id="" content_align="left" size="2" font_size="" line_height="" letter_spacing="" margin_top="0" margin_bottom="20px" text_color="" style_type="none" sep_color=""] ACCOMMODATIONS [/fusion_title][fusion_text] IUPUI will assign HILT participants who elect to stay in dormitory housing. Please be aware that dormitories are no-frills accommodations and require you to walk to the classroom buildings. It is expected that participants electing to stay in dormitory housing recognize this aspect of their stay. Pro-rating of dormitory stays are not possible.[/fusion_text][fusion_title hide_on_mobile="small-visibility,medium-visibility,large-visibility" class="" id="" content_align="left" size="3" font_size="" line_height="" letter_spacing="" margin_top="40px" margin_bottom="20px" margin_top_mobile="" margin_bottom_mobile="" text_color="" style_type="none" sep_color=""] Dormitory Information [/fusion_title][fusion_text columns="" column_min_width="" column_spacing="" rule_style="default" rule_size="" rule_color="" hide_on_mobile="small-visibility,medium-visibility,large-visibility" class="" id=""] HILT2019 Dormitory:

University Tower:

911 W. North Street

Indianapolis, IN 46202

317-274-8968

Tower Hall (corner of University Blvd and Michigan). The registration desk is located on the first floor of the building in the central lobby. Attendees may begin checking in after 1pm on June 2nd. Regular summer desk hours for check-in/out are as follows:
  • 8am – 9pm, Monday – Friday
  • 12pm – 6pm, Saturday & Sunday
HILT2019 Check in: You will proceed to the registration desk in Tower Hall. If the desk is not occupied, information on who to call when you arrive will be waiting for you. The RA on duty will meet you at the desk to get you into your dorm room. Please note the building doors lock at 9 pm thus entrance after 9 pm is by calling for access. The phone number will be posted on the front doors at Michigan Avenue and University Avenue. You will be met at those same doors at the corner of Michigan Avenue and University Avenue to be let into the building for registration. When you check in you will be given access to your assigned rooms. You can view room assignments on the dormitory assignments page. Each room will have a linen package that includes: 1 blanket, 1 flat sheet, 1 fitted sheet, 1 pillow, 1 pillow case, 1 bath towel, 1 hand towel, 1 washcloth, 1 bathmat. Shower curtain and toilet paper in each bathroom will be provided. The linen packets will be placed in each room prior to Check-In. Conference participants will make their own beds. We encourage you to bring an extra blanket or your own pillow for added comfort and familiarity. Please note that no toiletries such as soap, shampoo, and conditioner are included. Each room has individually controlled air-conditioning units. There is an ice machine on the 8th floor. When you are on the floor you get off the elevator and make a left. It is the first room on the left. There are wall sconces and lamps included in the room. Additional details are available in the Dormitory Guide. The nearest parking location to the Tower Hall Residences is the Hine Hall Parking Garage located adjacent to Tower and Hine Halls. As an FYI, Tower and Hine Hall are attached to one another via a short glassed walkway. Wifi credentials, meal passes, parking passes, and your HILT badge will be provided at the HILT registration desk. [/fusion_text][fusion_title hide_on_mobile="small-visibility,medium-visibility,large-visibility" class="" id="" content_align="left" size="3" font_size="" line_height="" letter_spacing="" margin_top="40px" margin_bottom="20px" text_color="" style_type="none" sep_color=""] Hotels [/fusion_title][fusion_text] Indianapolis is a major convention, leisure, and sporting destination and has lots of great places to stay. But because downtown stays so busy, it pays to plan ahead! HILT is not affiliated with the businesses contained in this listing nor are we able to negotiate any special rates. This listing is provided as a courtesy only. [/fusion_text][fusion_table fusion_table_type="2" hide_on_mobile="small-visibility,medium-visibility,large-visibility" class="" id="" animation_type="" animation_direction="left" animation_speed="0.3" animation_offset=""]
Candlewood Suites City Centre 1152 N. White River Parkway, West Drive Indianapolis, IN 46222 (317) 536-7700 The Alexander-A Dolce Hotel 333 South Delaware Street Indianapolis, IN 46204 317-624-8200
Courtyard Indianapolis Downtown 601 West Washington Street Indianapolis, Indiana 46204 (317) 822-9029 Residence Inn Downtown on the Canal 350 W New York St Indianapolis, Indiana 46202 (317) 822-0840
Fairfield Inn & Suites Indianapolis Downtown 501 West Washington Street Indianapolis, Indiana 46204 (317) 636-7678 Courtyard by Marriott Downtown Indianapolis, at the Capitol 320 N Senate Ave Indianapolis, Indiana 46202 (317) 684-7733
Crowne Plaza Hotel at Historic Union Station 123 W. Louisiana Street Indianapolis, IN 46225 (317) 631-2221 Nestle Inn 637 N East St Indianapolis, IN 46202 317-610-5200
Hampton Inn Downtown 105 S. Meridian Street Indianapolis, IN 46225 (317) 261-1200 Hilton Garden Inn Indianapolis Downtown 10 East Market Street Indianapolis, IN 46204 (317) 955-9700
Holiday Inn Express Hotel & Suites City Centre 410 S. Missouri Street Indianapolis, IN 46225 (317) 822-6400 Hyatt Regency Indianapolis Connected to Circle Center Mall One South Capitol Avenue Indianapolis, IN 46204 (317) 632-1234
Park Place City Centre 1150 N. White River Parkway, West Drive Indianapolis, IN 46222 (317) 829-1200 Indianapolis Marriott Downtown 350 West Maryland Street Indianapolis, IN 46225 (317) 822-3500
Radisson Hotel Indianapolis Airport 2500 S. High School Rd Indianapolis, IN 46241 (317) 244-3361 Spring Hill Suites Indianapolis Downtown 601 West Washington Street Indianapolis, Indiana 46204 (317) 972-7293
[/fusion_table][fusion_separator style_type="default" hide_on_mobile="small-visibility,medium-visibility,large-visibility" class="" id="" sep_color="" top_margin="" bottom_margin="" border_size="" icon="" icon_circle="" icon_circle_color="" width="" alignment="center" /][fusion_title hide_on_mobile="small-visibility,medium-visibility,large-visibility" class="" id="" content_align="left" size="1" font_size="" line_height="" letter_spacing="" margin_top="" margin_bottom="" margin_top_mobile="" margin_bottom_mobile="" text_color="" style_type="default" sep_color=""] Eid al-Fitr 2019 [/fusion_title][fusion_text columns="" column_min_width="" column_spacing="" rule_style="default" rule_size="" rule_color="" hide_on_mobile="small-visibility,medium-visibility,large-visibility" class="" id=""] For those seeking support for Eid al-Fitr 2019, we welcome you to contact the Muslim Alliance of Indiana, which can assist you in joining a local service during your time at HILT. [/fusion_text][fusion_separator style_type="default" hide_on_mobile="small-visibility,medium-visibility,large-visibility" class="" id="" sep_color="" top_margin="" bottom_margin="" border_size="" icon="" icon_circle="" icon_circle_color="" width="" alignment="center" /][fusion_title hide_on_mobile="small-visibility,medium-visibility,large-visibility" class="" id="" content_align="left" size="1" font_size="" line_height="" letter_spacing="" margin_top="" margin_bottom="" margin_top_mobile="" margin_bottom_mobile="" text_color="" style_type="default" sep_color=""] Hosted Meals [/fusion_title][fusion_text columns="" column_min_width="" column_spacing="" rule_style="default" rule_size="" rule_color="" hide_on_mobile="small-visibility,medium-visibility,large-visibility" class="" id=""] Registered participants are welcome to join us for breakfast Monday through Friday and lunch Monday through Thursday at no additional cost. Menus for these meals are available online as a PDF. No other meals will be provided during your stay. [/fusion_text][/fusion_builder_column][/fusion_builder_row][/fusion_builder_container][fusion_global id="2137"]

item.title: Cultural Heritage Experiences
item.dc:creator: jenguiliano
item.content:encoded:
[fusion_builder_container hundred_percent="no" equal_height_columns="no" menu_anchor="" hide_on_mobile="small-visibility,medium-visibility,large-visibility" class="" id="" background_color="" background_image="" background_position="center center" background_repeat="no-repeat" fade="no" background_parallax="none" parallax_speed="0.3" video_mp4="" video_webm="" video_ogv="" video_url="" video_aspect_ratio="16:9" video_loop="yes" video_mute="yes" overlay_color="" video_preview_image="" border_size="" border_color="" border_style="solid" padding_top="" padding_bottom="" padding_left="" padding_right=""][fusion_builder_row][fusion_builder_column type="1_1" layout="1_1" background_position="left top" background_color="" border_size="" border_color="" border_style="solid" border_position="all" spacing="yes" background_image="" background_repeat="no-repeat" padding_top="" padding_right="" padding_bottom="" padding_left="" margin_top="0px" margin_bottom="0px" class="" id="" animation_type="" animation_speed="0.3" animation_direction="left" hide_on_mobile="small-visibility,medium-visibility,large-visibility" center_content="no" last="no" min_height="" hover_type="none" link=""][fusion_text]HILT participants are invited to attend special experiences in the city of Indianapolis. Organized with our attendees and their interests in mind, taking part in these experience offers an opportunity to befriend fellow HILT participants outside of your classroom.[/fusion_text][/fusion_builder_column][fusion_builder_column type="1_1" layout="1_1" spacing="" center_content="no" hover_type="none" link="" min_height="" hide_on_mobile="small-visibility,medium-visibility,large-visibility" class="" id="" background_color="" background_image="" background_position="left top" undefined="" background_repeat="no-repeat" border_size="1" border_color="#bababa" border_style="solid" border_position="bottom" padding_top="" padding_right="" padding_bottom="" padding_left="" margin_top="" margin_bottom="" animation_type="" animation_direction="left" animation_speed="0.3" animation_offset="" last="no"][fusion_title hide_on_mobile="small-visibility,medium-visibility,large-visibility" class="" id="" content_align="left" size="2" font_size="" line_height="" letter_spacing="" margin_top="10px" margin_bottom="30px" margin_top_mobile="" margin_bottom_mobile="" text_color="" style_type="default" sep_color=""] Architectural Walking Tour of IUPUI and Downtown Indianapolis (this tour is now full). [/fusion_title][fusion_text columns="" column_min_width="" column_spacing="" rule_style="default" rule_size="" rule_color="" hide_on_mobile="small-visibility,medium-visibility,large-visibility" class="" id=""] Tuesday, June 4  |  6:00 – 7:30 pm Join architectural archivist Jordan Ryan for a brief walking tour of significant downtown Indianapolis architecture, including historic buildings designed by Rubush & Hunter, mid-century Modern and Brutalist structures, and more recent urban revitalization projects. Tour will leave from campus and be roughly 3 miles of walking. [/fusion_text][/fusion_builder_column][fusion_builder_column type="1_1" layout="1_1" spacing="" center_content="no" hover_type="none" link="" min_height="" hide_on_mobile="small-visibility,medium-visibility,large-visibility" class="" id="" background_color="" background_image="" background_position="left top" undefined="" background_repeat="no-repeat" border_size="1" border_color="#bababa" border_style="solid" border_position="bottom" padding_top="" padding_right="" padding_bottom="" padding_left="" margin_top="" margin_bottom="" animation_type="" animation_direction="left" animation_speed="0.3" animation_offset="" last="no"][fusion_title hide_on_mobile="small-visibility,medium-visibility,large-visibility" class="" id="" content_align="left" size="2" font_size="" line_height="" letter_spacing="" margin_top="10px" margin_bottom="30px" margin_top_mobile="" margin_bottom_mobile="" text_color="" style_type="default" sep_color=""] The Children's Museum [/fusion_title][fusion_text columns="" column_min_width="" column_spacing="" rule_style="default" rule_size="" rule_color="" hide_on_mobile="small-visibility,medium-visibility,large-visibility" class="" id=""] [caption id="attachment_2322" align="alignleft" width="300"] The Children's Museum welcomes visitors with dinosaurs and the Reilly Sports Legend Experience[/caption] Friday, June 7 | 10:00 am – Noon Guided Behind-the-Scenes Tour by Jennifer Noffze, Collections Manager, and the Children's Museum Staff The Children's Museum of Indianapolis is an award-winning museum located here in Indianapolis. HILT attendees will receive a tour of the museum’s collection that contains over 130,000 artifacts and specimens in the Arts & Humanities and Natural Sciences. You'll learn about the digital strategies the museum uses including the recently-released Ryan White Letters project. This tour will be Friday, June 7th from 10 am to noon. The museum is accessible to our attendees with physical, auditory, and visual concerns. Our tour includes free parking and free admission to the Museum only for registered HILT experience attendees. You can register through the HILT registration portal. Please note: HILT will not provide transportation to the museum. [/fusion_text][fusion_text columns="" column_min_width="" column_spacing="" rule_style="default" rule_size="" rule_color="" hide_on_mobile="small-visibility,medium-visibility,large-visibility" class="" id=""]

Please proceed to the information desk in the Children's Museum lobby no later than 9:45 am. You will be met by your tour hosts and provided with your entry tickets.

[/fusion_text][/fusion_builder_column][fusion_builder_column type="1_1" layout="1_1" spacing="" center_content="no" hover_type="none" link="" min_height="" hide_on_mobile="small-visibility,medium-visibility,large-visibility" class="" id="" background_color="" background_image="" background_position="left top" undefined="" background_repeat="no-repeat" border_size="1" border_color="#bababa" border_style="solid" border_position="bottom" padding_top="" padding_right="" padding_bottom="" padding_left="" margin_top="" margin_bottom="" animation_type="" animation_direction="left" animation_speed="0.3" animation_offset="" last="no"][fusion_title hide_on_mobile="small-visibility,medium-visibility,large-visibility" class="" id="" content_align="left" size="2" font_size="" line_height="" letter_spacing="" margin_top="10px" margin_bottom="0" margin_top_mobile="" margin_bottom_mobile="" text_color="" style_type="default" sep_color=""] The Indiana Historical Society [/fusion_title][fusion_title hide_on_mobile="small-visibility,medium-visibility,large-visibility" class="" id="" content_align="left" size="3" font_size="" line_height="" letter_spacing="" margin_top="0" margin_bottom="30px" margin_top_mobile="" margin_bottom_mobile="" text_color="" style_type="default" sep_color=""] Guided Behind-the Scenes Tour [/fusion_title][fusion_text columns="" column_min_width="" column_spacing="" rule_style="default" rule_size="" rule_color="" hide_on_mobile="small-visibility,medium-visibility,large-visibility" class="" id=""] Friday, June 7 | 10:00 am – Noon Guided Behind-the Scenes Tour with Susan Sutton, Director of Digitization and the IHS Exhibitions Staff Since 1830, the Indiana Historical Society has connected people to Indiana's past by collecting, preserving and sharing the state’s history. A private, nonprofit membership organization, IHS maintains the nation’s premier research library and archives on the history of Indiana and the Old Northwest and presents a unique set of visitor experiences called the Indiana Experience. In this behind-the-scenes experience participants will explore what it takes to research and design museum exhibits that include digital aspects. You'll also receive exposure to digital preservation efforts and the methods leveraged to preserve  the analog paper-based collection. The museum is accessible to our attendees with physical, auditory, and visual concerns.  Admission to the historical society and museum will be free with registration for the tour. You can register through the HILT registration portal. We encourage those staying on campus to walk to the society.  Please note: HILT will not provide transportation to the society. [/fusion_text][fusion_text columns="" column_min_width="" column_spacing="" rule_style="default" rule_size="" rule_color="" hide_on_mobile="small-visibility,medium-visibility,large-visibility" class="" id=""]

Please proceed to the information desk in the IHS lobby no later than 9:45 am. You will be met by your tour hosts. Please make sure to wear the yellow wristband that was provided in your name badge as it serves as your entry ticket to the tour.

[/fusion_text][/fusion_builder_column][fusion_builder_column type="1_1" layout="1_1" spacing="" center_content="no" hover_type="none" link="" min_height="" hide_on_mobile="small-visibility,medium-visibility,large-visibility" class="" id="" background_color="" background_image="" background_position="left top" undefined="" background_repeat="no-repeat" border_size="1" border_color="#bababa" border_style="solid" border_position="bottom" padding_top="" padding_right="" padding_bottom="" padding_left="" margin_top="" margin_bottom="" animation_type="" animation_direction="left" animation_speed="0.3" animation_offset="" last="no"][fusion_title hide_on_mobile="small-visibility,medium-visibility,large-visibility" class="" id="" content_align="left" size="2" font_size="" line_height="" letter_spacing="" margin_top="10px" margin_bottom="0" margin_top_mobile="" margin_bottom_mobile="" text_color="" style_type="default" sep_color=""]Indianapolis Museum of Art at Newfields[/fusion_title][fusion_title hide_on_mobile="small-visibility,medium-visibility,large-visibility" class="" id="" content_align="left" size="3" font_size="" line_height="" letter_spacing="" margin_top="0" margin_bottom="30px" margin_top_mobile="" margin_bottom_mobile="" text_color="" style_type="default" sep_color=""]Guided Behind-the Scenes Tour[/fusion_title][fusion_text columns="" column_min_width="" column_spacing="" rule_style="default" rule_size="" rule_color="" hide_on_mobile="small-visibility,medium-visibility,large-visibility" class="" id=""] [caption id="attachment_2355" align="alignleft" width="300"] Step into the Seasons of Japan invites guests into an immersive, interactive, multi-sensory experience.[/caption] Friday, June 7  |  10:00 am – Noon Guided Behind-the Scenes Tour with software developers Ezra Birt and Daniel Keller of the Newfields Lab and Jen Mayhill, assistant director of interpretation, and Tascha Horowitz, director of interpretation, media, and publishing. One of the largest art museums in the country, with 5,000 years of art history and active exhibition and education programs, The Indianapolis Museum of Art is the site of the Oldfields estate and the 152-campus Newfields campus. It is surrounded by historic landscapes, gardens, performance spaces, and an art and nature park, home to wetlands, woodlands, and outdoor sculptures. In this behind-the-scenes experience participants will experience the Step into the Seasons of Japan immersive room, the Clowes Portraits digital book, the Japanese Fashion virtual dressing room, and Design Gallery Miller House VR The museum is accessible to our attendees with physical, auditory, and visual concerns.  Admission to the IMA will be free with registration for the tour. You can register through the HILT registration portal. The IMA at Newfields is located approximately a block west of the corner of 38th and Michigan Road (which—don’t be confused—is called Martin Luther King Jr. Street south of 38th). It’s free to park in the underground garage or the large surface lot near the museum. When you enter off 38th Street and want to park in the garage, just follow the signs. Please note: HILT will not provide transportation to the IMA. [/fusion_text][fusion_text columns="" column_min_width="" column_spacing="" rule_style="default" rule_size="" rule_color="" hide_on_mobile="small-visibility,medium-visibility,large-visibility" class="" id=""]

Please proceed to the information desk in the IMA entrance no later than 9:45 am. You will be met by your tour hosts and provided with your entry tickets.

[/fusion_text][/fusion_builder_column][/fusion_builder_row][/fusion_builder_container][fusion_global id="2137"]

item.title: Dine Arounds

item.content:encoded:

Is this your first  time at Humanities Intensive Learning & Teaching? Are you new to Digital Humanities community? Do you just want to see more of Indianapolis, IN? Join a small group of HILT participants at a local Indy restaurant, to make scholarly connections and begin new friendships.

Dinners will happen each evening, with parties meeting at the selected restaurant. We’d like to keep to small groups so we ask that you sign up for your dinner via our google form.

[/fusion_text][/fusion_builder_column][/fusion_builder_row][/fusion_builder_container][fusion_global id="2137"]

item.title: Accessibility
item.dc:creator: jenguiliano
item.content:encoded:
[fusion_builder_container hundred_percent="no" equal_height_columns="no" menu_anchor="" hide_on_mobile="small-visibility,medium-visibility,large-visibility" class="" id="" background_color="" background_image="" background_position="center center" background_repeat="no-repeat" fade="no" background_parallax="none" parallax_speed="0.3" video_mp4="" video_webm="" video_ogv="" video_url="" video_aspect_ratio="16:9" video_loop="yes" video_mute="yes" overlay_color="" video_preview_image="" border_size="" border_color="" border_style="solid" padding_top="" padding_bottom="" padding_left="" padding_right=""][fusion_builder_row][fusion_builder_column type="1_1" layout="1_1" background_position="left top" background_color="" border_size="" border_color="" border_style="solid" border_position="all" spacing="yes" background_image="" background_repeat="no-repeat" padding_top="" padding_right="" padding_bottom="" padding_left="" margin_top="0px" margin_bottom="0px" class="" id="" animation_type="" animation_speed="0.3" animation_direction="left" hide_on_mobile="small-visibility,medium-visibility,large-visibility" center_content="no" last="no" min_height="" hover_type="none" link=""][fusion_text columns="" column_min_width="" column_spacing="" rule_style="default" rule_size="" rule_color="" hide_on_mobile="small-visibility,medium-visibility,large-visibility" class="" id=""]

As part of HILT's commitment to our participants, we encourage all attendees to be aware of accessibility and inclusion. To assist with that awareness, below are details on accessibility related to all official locations we will be using for the event. Accessibility information for the Cultural Heritage excursions are available on that specific page.

If you have specific accessibility needs, please do not hesitate to contact us at dhtraining01@gmail.com or via DM on twitter @HILT_DH.

Locations

The campus maintains a dynamic accessibility map that allows users to map all handicapped-accessible entrances.

University Tower

University Tower includes Tower Dining, all dormitory housing for HILT2019, and the HILT Social Reception. It is located at 911 W North St, Indianapolis, IN 46202-3104. It is the building situated at the corner of Michigan and University that is physically attached to Hine Hall (to its East). The building is U-shaped so if you enter from Hine Hall you can proceed all the way around the U to get to Tower Dining.

Due to construction in the central courtyard between University Tower and Hine Hall, all participants are encouraged to enter through the Southeast entrance at corner of Michigan and University. This is also the entrance closest to Tower Dining and the dormitory entrance.

Elevators to the second floor where the Social Reception will be held are available in the central connector between University Tower (the left building) and Hine Hall (the right building). Elevators to the dormitory housing are located in the University Hall lobby near the Dormitory Housing & Residence Life desk. The housing desk can provide assistance for those with accessibility needs related to moving luggage.

If you need assistance at meal times, staff within Tower Dining can assist in navigating the buffet.

Handicap-accessible parking is available in the parking garage located on North Street with elevators depositing you directly into the University Tower lobby.

University Library

All classes, coffee events, registration, and the HILT Community Ignite will take place in the University Library, which located at 755 W Michigan St, Indianapolis , IN 46202-5195. Situated on the central quad, the primary entrance to the Library is via the main entrance on the northside of the building.

Elevators to the basement (where the Lilly Auditorium is located) and all floors are located in the center of the building. We apologize that the elevators are notoriously slow moving between floors.

If you need assistance navigating your classroom or at coffee breaks, please do not hesitate to ask Jen or Trevor for assistance.

Handicap-accessible parking is available directly next to the University Library via the New York Street entrance. All other parking is available in the North Street Garage. Please note that the North Street garage is connected via tunnels to both University Tower and University Library via Hine Hall and the SPEA building, respectively.

Course Materials

Course materials will be provided by instructors to all students for their personal use. We encourage anyone who needs a physical copy of their materials to notify their instructor so a printed packet can be prepared prior to the class.

[/fusion_text][/fusion_builder_column][/fusion_builder_row][/fusion_builder_container][fusion_global id="2137"]

item.title: Dormitory Assignments
item.dc:creator: jenguiliano
item.content:encoded:
[fusion_builder_container hundred_percent="no" equal_height_columns="no" menu_anchor="" hide_on_mobile="small-visibility,medium-visibility,large-visibility" class="" id="" background_color="" background_image="" background_position="center center" background_repeat="no-repeat" fade="no" background_parallax="none" parallax_speed="0.3" video_mp4="" video_webm="" video_ogv="" video_url="" video_aspect_ratio="16:9" video_loop="yes" video_mute="yes" overlay_color="" video_preview_image="" border_size="" border_color="" border_style="solid" padding_top="" padding_bottom="" padding_left="" padding_right=""][fusion_builder_row][fusion_builder_column type="1_1" layout="1_1" background_position="left top" background_color="" border_size="" border_color="" border_style="solid" border_position="all" spacing="yes" background_image="" background_repeat="no-repeat" padding_top="" padding_right="" padding_bottom="" padding_left="" margin_top="0px" margin_bottom="0px" class="" id="" animation_type="" animation_speed="0.3" animation_direction="left" hide_on_mobile="small-visibility,medium-visibility,large-visibility" center_content="no" last="no" min_height="" hover_type="none" link=""][fusion_title hide_on_mobile="small-visibility,medium-visibility,large-visibility" class="" id="" content_align="left" size="3" font_size="" line_height="" letter_spacing="" margin_top="" margin_bottom="" margin_top_mobile="" margin_bottom_mobile="" text_color="" style_type="underline solid" sep_color=""] Dormitory Information [/fusion_title][fusion_text columns="" column_min_width="" column_spacing="" rule_style="default" rule_size="" rule_color="" hide_on_mobile="small-visibility,medium-visibility,large-visibility" class="" id=""] HILT2019 Dormitory — University Tower: 911 W. North Street Indianapolis, IN 46202 317-274-8968 Tower Hall (corner of University Blvd and Michigan). The registration desk is located on the first floor of the building in the central lobby. Attendees may begin checking in after 1pm on June 2nd. Regular summer desk hours for check-in/out are as follows:
  • 8am – 9pm, Monday – Friday
  • 12pm – 6pm, Saturday & Sunday
HILT2019 Check in: You will proceed to the registration desk in Tower Hall. If the desk is not occupied, information on who to call when you arrive will be waiting for you. The RA on duty will meet you at the desk to get you into your dorm room. Please note the building doors lock at 9 pm thus entrance after 9 pm is by calling for access. The phone number will be posted on the front doors at Michigan Avenue and University Avenue. You will be met at those same doors at the corner of Michigan Avenue and University Avenue to be let into the building for registration. When you check in you will be given access to your assigned rooms. You can view room assignments below. Each room will have a linen package that includes: 1 blanket, 1 flat sheet, 1 fitted sheet, 1 pillow, 1 pillow case, 1 bath towel, 1 hand towel, 1 washcloth, 1 bathmat. Shower curtain and toilet paper in each bathroom will be provided. The linen packets will be placed in each room prior to Check-In. Conference participants will make their own beds. We encourage you to bring an extra blanket or your own pillow for added comfort and familiarity. Please note that no toiletries such as soap, shampoo, and conditioner are included. Each room has individually controlled air-conditioning units. There is an ice machine on the 8th floor. When you are on the floor you get off the elevator and make a left. It is the first room on the left. There are wall sconces and lamps included in the room. Additional details are available in the Dormitory Guide. The nearest parking location to the Tower Hall Residences is the Hine Hall Parking Garage located adjacent to Tower and Hine Halls. As an FYI, Tower and Hine Hall are attached to one another via a short glassed walkway. Wifi credentials, meal passes, parking passes, and your HILT badge will be provided at the HILT registration desk. item.title: IGNITE
item.dc:creator: jenguiliano
item.content:encoded: [fusion_builder_container hundred_percent="no" equal_height_columns="no" menu_anchor="" hide_on_mobile="small-visibility,medium-visibility,large-visibility" class="" id="" background_color="" background_image="" background_position="center center" background_repeat="no-repeat" fade="no" background_parallax="none" parallax_speed="0.3" video_mp4="" video_webm="" video_ogv="" video_url="" video_aspect_ratio="16:9" video_loop="yes" video_mute="yes" overlay_color="" video_preview_image="" border_size="" border_color="" border_style="solid" padding_top="" padding_bottom="" padding_left="" padding_right=""][fusion_builder_row][fusion_builder_column type="1_1" layout="1_1" background_position="left top" background_color="" border_size="" border_color="" border_style="solid" border_position="all" spacing="yes" background_image="" background_repeat="no-repeat" padding_top="" padding_right="" padding_bottom="" padding_left="" margin_top="0px" margin_bottom="0px" class="" id="" animation_type="" animation_speed="0.3" animation_direction="left" hide_on_mobile="small-visibility,medium-visibility,large-visibility" center_content="no" last="no" min_height="" hover_type="none" link=""][fusion_text columns="" column_min_width="" column_spacing="" rule_style="default" rule_size="" rule_color="" hide_on_mobile="small-visibility,medium-visibility,large-visibility" class="" id=""]You are our keynote speakers for HILT. We love hearing from the community of HILT attendees what you are working on or thinking about so we’ll be holding an Ignite-style evening of short presentations on Monday, June 3rd. all designed to get others excited about an idea, a project, a theory, an experience, or just you. In keeping with the spirit of Ignite events, we ask that presenters keep these talks short and engaging. Each presenter will have 2 minutes on stage. Each presentation will consist of 1 slide. Make it interesting; make it fun; make it all about you! We will provide laptop, digital projector, and microphone. If you’d like to participate, please fill out the form below (including uploading your slide) no later than 3:00 pm on Monday, June 3. For any questions about the community keynotes, email trevor.munoz@gmail.com, with the subject line “[IGNITE]”[/fusion_text][/fusion_builder_column][/fusion_builder_row][/fusion_builder_container][fusion_global id="2137"]

item.title: Dates + Costs
item.dc:creator: kirstenkeister
item.content:encoded:
[fusion_builder_container hundred_percent="no" equal_height_columns="no" menu_anchor="" hide_on_mobile="small-visibility,medium-visibility,large-visibility" class="" id="" background_color="" background_image="" background_position="center center" background_repeat="no-repeat" fade="no" background_parallax="none" parallax_speed="0.3" video_mp4="" video_webm="" video_ogv="" video_url="" video_aspect_ratio="16:9" video_loop="yes" video_mute="yes" overlay_color="" video_preview_image="" border_size="" border_color="" border_style="solid" padding_top="" padding_bottom="" padding_left="" padding_right=""][fusion_builder_row][fusion_builder_column type="1_1" layout="1_1" background_position="left top" background_color="" border_size="" border_color="" border_style="solid" border_position="all" spacing="yes" background_image="" background_repeat="no-repeat" padding_top="" padding_right="" padding_bottom="" padding_left="" margin_top="0px" margin_bottom="0px" class="" id="" animation_type="" animation_speed="0.3" animation_direction="left" hide_on_mobile="small-visibility,medium-visibility,large-visibility" center_content="no" last="no" min_height="" hover_type="none" link=""][fusion_title margin_top="" margin_bottom="30px" hide_on_mobile="small-visibility,medium-visibility,large-visibility" class="" id="" size="2" content_align="left" style_type="none" sep_color=""] DATES [/fusion_title][fusion_text columns="" column_min_width="" column_spacing="" rule_style="default" rule_size="" rule_color="" hide_on_mobile="small-visibility,medium-visibility,large-visibility" class="" id="" animation_type="" animation_direction="left" animation_speed="0.3" animation_offset=""]
  • Registration: December 12, 2019-April 15, 2020
  • Late Registration: April 15, 2020-May 15, 2020 (dorms are unavailable during late registration)
You can register here. [/fusion_text][fusion_title hide_on_mobile="small-visibility,medium-visibility,large-visibility" class="" id="" content_align="left" size="2" font_size="" line_height="" letter_spacing="" margin_top="40px" margin_bottom="10px" text_color="" style_type="none" sep_color=""] COSTS [/fusion_title][fusion_title hide_on_mobile="small-visibility,medium-visibility,large-visibility" class="" id="" content_align="left" size="3" font_size="" line_height="" letter_spacing="" margin_top="40px" margin_bottom="20px" text_color="" style_type="none" sep_color=""] Registration [/fusion_title][fusion_text columns="" column_min_width="" column_spacing="" rule_style="default" rule_size="" rule_color="" hide_on_mobile="small-visibility,medium-visibility,large-visibility" class="" id=""]
  • Standard: $975
  • Early Career Scholars and Cultural Heritage Professionals: $775
  • Student: $550
Registration fees includes admittance to one course, our community event, as well as breakfast and lunch in our campus dining hall. [/fusion_text][fusion_title hide_on_mobile="small-visibility,medium-visibility,large-visibility" class="" id="" content_align="left" size="3" font_size="" line_height="" letter_spacing="" margin_top="40px" margin_bottom="20px" text_color="" style_type="none" sep_color=""] Scholarships [/fusion_title][fusion_text columns="" column_min_width="" column_spacing="" rule_style="default" rule_size="" rule_color="" hide_on_mobile="small-visibility,medium-visibility,large-visibility" class="" id="" animation_type="" animation_direction="left" animation_speed="0.3" animation_offset=""] This year, we are offering a number of discounts for friends of HILT: University of Nebraska Lincoln Scholarships: Faculty, staff, and students at the University of Nebraska Lincoln are eligible for UNL specific scholarships. To request a UNL scholarship, please apply via our UNL Scholarships page. Group Discounts: Any group of 5 who register together are eligible for a 25% discount. Group Discount options are available by looking in the lower right hand side of the registration homepage. Sponsored Student Scholarships are available to full-time enrolled students, early career scholars (terminal degree within 5 years), and current employees of galleries, archives, and museums. You MUST apply for (and be notified that you have received) a scholarship prior to beginning registration. You will be provided with a registration code to complete registration to receive the scholarship discount of $250.  Adjusted fees will be $275 (students) and $525 (early career scholars or cultural heritage professionals). There are a limited number of sponsored student scholarships. They will be awarded on a rolling-basis until exhausted. Please note you cannot combine group scholarships and student scholarships. Apply Now! [/fusion_text][fusion_title hide_on_mobile="small-visibility,medium-visibility,large-visibility" class="" id="" content_align="left" size="3" font_size="" line_height="" letter_spacing="" margin_top="40px" margin_bottom="20px" text_color="" style_type="none" sep_color=""] Housing [/fusion_title][fusion_text columns="" column_min_width="" column_spacing="" rule_style="default" rule_size="" rule_color="" hide_on_mobile="small-visibility,medium-visibility,large-visibility" class="" id="" animation_type="" animation_direction="left" animation_speed="0.3" animation_offset=""] University of Nebraska Campus Housing will be offered for an additional fee. Housing rates are as follows. Double Occupancy Room (price per person): $37.16 per night Shared Bedroom in a 2-bedroom, 4-person suite Single Occupancy Room (price per person): $55.75 per night Private Room in Shared 4-bedroom suite Private Suite (price per person): $89.50 per night Private Suite for 1 individual Housing fees include access to your assigned room from Sunday, May 17 (3 pm) to Friday, May 22 (10 am), linens, as well as breakfast and lunch in our campus dining facilities. All dormitory rooms are non-smoking. Please be aware that dormitories are no-frills accommodations and require you to walk to the classroom buildings. It is expected that participants electing to stay in dormitory housing recognize this aspect of their stay. Pro-rating of dormitory stays are not possible. University Suites is modern residence hall is located in the heart of the UNL campus. Amenities for double rooms:
  • Twin XL beds, contemporary furnishings
  • Full attached bathroom
  • In-room temperature control
  • Free wireless Internet
You will book your housing directly with UNL via this link: https://uh-registration.unl.edu/HILT2020 [/fusion_text][fusion_title hide_on_mobile="small-visibility,medium-visibility,large-visibility" class="" id="" content_align="left" size="3" font_size="" line_height="" letter_spacing="" margin_top="40px" margin_bottom="20px" text_color="" style_type="none" sep_color=""] Parking [/fusion_title][fusion_text columns="" column_min_width="" column_spacing="" rule_style="default" rule_size="" rule_color="" hide_on_mobile="small-visibility,medium-visibility,large-visibility" class="" id="" animation_type="" animation_direction="left" animation_speed="0.3" animation_offset=""] Attendees staying at University Suites will receive a surface lot permit at no additional charge. [/fusion_text][fusion_title title_type="text" rotation_effect="bounceIn" display_time="1200" highlight_effect="circle" loop_animation="off" highlight_width="9" highlight_top_margin="0" before_text="" rotation_text="" highlight_text="" after_text="" hide_on_mobile="small-visibility,medium-visibility,large-visibility" class="" id="" content_align="left" size="3" font_size="" animated_font_size="" line_height="" letter_spacing="" margin_top="" margin_bottom="" margin_top_mobile="" margin_bottom_mobile="" text_color="" animated_text_color="" highlight_color="" style_type="default" sep_color=""] Cancellation Policy [/fusion_title][fusion_text columns="" column_min_width="" column_spacing="" rule_style="default" rule_size="" rule_color="" hide_on_mobile="small-visibility,medium-visibility,large-visibility" class="" id="" animation_type="" animation_direction="left" animation_speed="0.3" animation_offset=""] Full refunds are available minus a $30.00 processing fee until April 15, 2020. You are able to substitute another registrant at no cost until May 1, 2020. After May 1, 2020, there are no refunds. [/fusion_text][/fusion_builder_column][/fusion_builder_row][/fusion_builder_container][fusion_global id="2523"]

item.title: Logistics
item.dc:creator: kirstenkeister
item.content:encoded:
[fusion_builder_container hundred_percent="no" hundred_percent_height="no" hundred_percent_height_scroll="no" hundred_percent_height_center_content="yes" equal_height_columns="no" menu_anchor=""
